text: Nice amber pour, decent off white head. Nose is carmel malt. Lightly bitter. Middle is woody hops, caramel, medium mouthfeel. Finish is spicy and bitter.

Recently enjoyed this amber ale fresh on tap in Hershey, PA. Poured a standard but appealing amber ale appearance with proportionate white foam, while the aroma is surprisingly herbal and hoppy for the style. Hop-forward flavor yet with a caramel malty contrast, this medium-bodied ale was a unique and enjoyable rendition of the style.

Tap. Floral hops and caramel malt. Pours a rich brown amber with white lace top. Taste has a similar sweet sour balance and both would be light to medium for me. Carbonation too. Considering how boring a balanced ale can be, this pleases
12oz Flasche. Schöne Bernsteinfarbe. Cremiger Schaum. Orange und Malz datu Karamel Duft. Antrunk erstmal dezent. Dann Karamel und Hopfenblume. Süffig und lecker.

Bottle into my new Honest Weight willi becher. Pours kind of flat with the usual amber color for the style. Aroma of malt with a hint of citrus. Flavor is overly malty, bitter just a bit, caramel and toast. Mild bitter finish which doesnt linger. Decent enough brew, but Ive lost my taste for amber ales.

Not too special, but clear and has a malty character.

Âmbar translúcida, espuma alaranjada de ótima formação e persistência. Aroma carregado de caramelo, malte, lúpulos florais, leve amadeirado. Sabor de médio dulçor, amargor um pouco menos intenso. Corpo leve e média carbonatação. Com tempo de vai ficando menos floral e lupulada transparecendo mais o malte, mel, leve alaranjada, complexa na medida, final de média persistência e ótimo drinkability. Belíssimo exemplar.

6-pack bottles. Closer to an IPA than a traditional amber ale. Theres some caramel malt giving it color and a bit more backbone to it, but the hops are the star. If not a hop blockbuster, this definitely brings the hop flavor (pine and citrus). Very good.

Cloudy, amber pout with thin, beige foam. Floral hops in the nose and a muted caramel malt. Light body and light fizz. The hops become more pronounced in the taste and provide a lingering finish. The hop presence makes the amber ale less malty and very pleasant.

Copper color with a tallish beige head. Fresh citric aromas with a toasted 
and caramel malt background. I dare say, I hoppy amber, but Seems to be a bit more. Rich caramel light licorice and all kinds of hops flavors. 
Unfortunately Im still stuck thinking about a hoppy amber. 5/11
Absolute best Amber Ale Ive had to date. Everything about it is wonderful!

Draft with Bill, amber color with small to medium tiny bubbled head. Aromas and flavor of sweet candy, ash, tobacco, malt, and late harvest stale hops. Body is thin. Finish is sweet and astringent. Too spicy!
On tap: Reddish amber color. Citric, yeasty and caramel aroma. Earthy/grassy hop flavor alongside some light toffee. ThIs has a little bit of everything going on, really nice amber ale in my book.
Sample on tap @ the brewery. Pours a clear dark amber with a thin white ring. Not much of an aroma. Pretty plain and ordinary without much flavor or aftertaste. Disappointing.

Deep Amber thin white Lacy head; aroma is mild malt grain; flava is malty yet dry with hops notes of woody spice; feels medium to light decent fizz; finishes tangy malty
Mildly bitter
Bread yeast aromas. Pours red gold with an off white head. Nice notes of leather and apricot. Short finish. Low carbonation. Good Amber.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2016 Copper pour minimal head. Lacking aroma. Muddied hop bitter with anise. Strong bitter finish and aftertaste. Didn?t feel it matched the commercial description at all. Not grapefruit or Floral notes. I had to double check they labeled the sample right.
Nice amber color with a white head. Slight malty aroma. Very malty beer with good hop bitterness and a hint of licorice.

On tap at Poe House. So much better than expected- both for the brewery and the style. Well balanced - has the right caramel notes for an amber but doesnt drink overly sweet. Spicy pine and flowers from the hops. Bit of earth as well. One of the better ambers I have had in awhile.
Brown red pour with a faint caramel aroma. Flavor is earthy, a bit sweet and some nice maltiness.wasnt really that hoppy forward to me, quite malty. Still, quite good.

355ml bottle. Amber with one finger off white head. Aroma is caramel, orange, zesty grapefruit and citrus. Similar taste with initial caramel sweetness followed by orange and citrus and ending in bitter citrus. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Flight shared with ebone1988 at the brewery. The pour is a pale golden orange with a thin ring of gray head and a couple spots of lace. The aroma smells like a cat got wet and is air drying. Its musty, dusty, and not good. There is a sweet maltiness just going on in the background that i dont care for. The flavor is also not good. There is a nerds candy flavor as if it were mixed with water. There is a light malt and its pretty basic otherwise. Its a bit disappointing. The mouth feel is weird. Its thicker, but watery at the same time. The carbonation is light and allows it to fall right off the tongue. The aftertaste is lingering malt and candy sweetness.

Flight shared with koleminer20 at Tröegs. Aroma is malty, caramel, earthy hops, pine. Appearance is amber, clear, light tan head. Taste is caramel malt, earthy hops, toffee, spice, pine, bitter. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, caramel malt aftertaste. Overall, this is a real weird amber.
Taste is sweet yet bitter. Aroma of caramel, floral hops, and citrus. Nice amber ale. Somewhat hoppy. Enjoyed it overall.

It pours amber with a slightly off white head. There are aromas of fruit, plums, bad roasted elements. It has falvors of plums, roasted malts, fruit, and floral hops. It has a moderate feel that is the lighter side of moderate. It has a bitter finish.

12 oz bottle into a lager glass. 

Clear, deep amber body with a moderate amount of visible carbonation. Excellent, bone-colored, foamy head. 

Lots of hops in the nose but these are more subdued in the flavor where they are also dominated by sweet and medium roasted grains. Lightly bitter. 

Medium body and carbonation. 

Overall: A well-crafted, hoppy amber ale.

0,355 l bottle from Biervana 
caramel, citrus, herbs, floral, amber, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation,

Bought @ Kroger-SwiftCreek Midlothian,Va 4/1/16 Nicely balanced Hops Vs. Malt Great Amber color LOTS of carbonation Loads of flavor in this beer! I consider this better than their Nugget Nectar! Great session ale which will sneak up on you being 6 per cent! Refreshing mouthfeel Wonderful beer anytime! ENJOY!!

Tasted from bottle. Pours a nice dark amber with off white head. Aroma is sweet caramel, pine, floral notes. Taste is moderately sweet with a nice mild bitterness. Flavors of caramel, toffee, a little bit of nuts, earthy notes, pine. Very well done amber. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, thanks Christina! Rich caramel malt aroma with some citrus and and a touch of piney hops. Pours amber colored with a thin tan head with some retention and good lacing. Starts with with caramel malt and toffee sweetness as well as a bit of breadiness. Finishes dry, but not overly so with grapefruit citrus hop flavor with a bit of pine hop bitterness. A little bitter on the finish, but a very nice amber overall.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 5/13/2015. Pours fairly crystal clear deep orange/copper color with a 1-2 finger dense and fluffy light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of grapefruit, tangerine, apricot, lemon zest, orange peel, light pepper/pine, caramel, toasted bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of citrus/floral/earthy hops and moderate dark/bready malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, apricot, lemon zest, orange peel, light pepper, pine, caramel, toasted bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, apricot, lemon/orange peel, light pepper, pine, caramel, toasted bread, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/earthy/pine hops and moderate dark/bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness as well. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately sticky, and lightly creamy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent amber ale. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/herbal/pine hops and moderate dark/bready malt flavors; and very smooth and easy to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Learys in Newburyport, MA. Aroma is nice floral hops, berry, some cheese, basement funk and bread. Appearance is gorgeous clear dark orange with nice sparkle, 1/2 finger-width off-white head with fair retention and lacing. Taste is mild caramel sweet balanced with tart and bitter. Palate is light bodied with thin texture, average carbonation and dry, crisp lightly bitter finish. Overall, theres a fair amount of depth here. I wish the ending was a little bit more to the sweet side but this is good.
Bottle. Lots of grapefruit, some mandarine, worty-bready, slightly pumpernikel infused malt base. Rather shy bitterness given the style. Ok.

Bottle to shaker glass, pours clear deep amber. One plus finger light tan head. Nice lacing with moderate retention. Aroma of caramel and grapefruit. The taste has a moderate caramel sweetness which is balanced by an earthy bitterness. Medium bodied, light carbonation, creamy mouth feel. Finishes dry. Tasting notes of caramel, sour apple, herbs, pink grapefruit, walnut and white pepper. A solid amber ale. Ive had many of these in the past, cant believe Ive never rated it.
Bottle from Wholefoods. Caramel and fruit punch aroma. Sweet caramel and fruit punch taste with a dry bitter finish. Not bad.

Pours a gorgeous dark amber color and has excellent lacing. Smells almost of nothing.....Has a faint malt and hop aroma. Sadly, the taste translates from the aroma. Has a mild taste of hops but is mainly sweet and malty, but not overly so.

Drank from a pint glass poured from a twelve ounce bottle. Pours a beautiful dark amber color with little white head. Smells amazing, perfect aromas of citrus hops and nice maltiness. Tastes a bit bland though, would love some more malt flavor, a good brew nonetheless!

Poured from the tap at the Blue & Gray Pub in Gettysburg, PA into a pint glass. This beer is a light copper color with a small tan head. The aroma is big on hops and citrus with a hint of pine. The flavor is full of hops and has that citrus finish. The brew is medium bodied with moderate carbonation. A great ale.

Clear brown amber with minimal head and sticky lacing. 
Nice bitterness up front with a clean finish. 
Toffee, rusty, a bit metallic. 
$9.99/multi sixer at Wegmans Leesburg VA

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2016 Pours amber in color, faint head. The aroma is rich, brown sugar notes, some citrus. The flavor adds apples, coriander, and a faint, grassy burn from the hops. 

Amended review:  I had this again eight months after my first review, and I liked it a lot more than I did originally.  I picked up on some mild whiskey notes this time, and some spice.  Its delicious.  Ive re-rated it from a 3.2 to a 3.8.
6 oz pour into shaker from tap. Orange, fairly clear, moderate head. Pleasantly bitter and fruity. A hint of sweetness. Nose is citrus, pine, and bitter
Draft in shaker, clear dark amber full bodied ale. Thin white head. Caramel malt flavor backed by hops, long finish.
Bottle to glass. Pours a nice amber color with an off white head. Aroma is huge hops, citrus, floral, resiny. Nice crisp amber malts, caramel, toast. Delicious amber!
Pours amber with a small, light tan head and some lacing. Light mouthfeel with a peach-ish taste and bitter finish. Solid.

I poured it from the bottle into a pint glass. It pours amber with a tan head and lacing. The aroma is pine and dried fruit. The taste is strong on hops and dried fruit with some biscuit and malt. Theres nice carbonation balanced with some smoothness. This is one of the best ambers Ive had.

One of the better ambers that I have had. Pours a copper clear with one finger head that dissipates.lacing minimal . Aroma of caramel, floral hops, biscuit medium bitter. Medium finish. Moderate carbonation.
Petty good for an Amber ale. Lots of floral hop aroma. Flavor is not bad, though a bit mild for my usual taste preferences. Finish is bitter, but overall its a fairly well balanced ale.

Bottle 355ml @ Hotel room, The International Cozy Inn, New York, NY
Pours hazy copper with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, peach, citrus and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long peach and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. A clear, dark golden to amber colored beer topped by a small, dense, off-white head. The aroma is lightly bready, with caramel malts, perfumed candy and some pine cones and grass. Its medium to full-bodied, with a soft carbonation. Rather dry. Less bread and caramel in the flavor, a decent bitterness showing up and theres also a piney, grassy touch and some candy hints. Mostly bitter finish. A rather boring one, but at least it drinks easy. 150625
Pours a deep full amber with a white head which lingers.......aroma of malt, citrus.....taste is heavy citrus, bread, crisp, clean....quite good.
I very much enjoyed this amber ale, one of my favorites of the style, so far. Aroma was nice, perhaps reflecting it being "hopback"

On tap at Shiki Sushi. Pours clear reddish copper with a pillowy white head. Aroma is mild pine hops. Taste is similar, piney hops with a caramel malt backing. Body is about average, slightly creamy texture. Overall a decent amber ale. Not my favorite style but a solid enough offering.
On Tap. Leicht trübes orangegoldenes Bier mit einer schönen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig harzig, Aprikosen, kräftig hopfig. Geschmack kräftig malzig, sehr hopfig, Aprikose, reife Früchte.
Clear , amber color; medium-size head. Aroma of caramel malt with a decent hoppy hit. Same notes in balanced taste . Good, hoppy beer.

Pours clear dark red. Mouthfeel is light.. Smells hops and spices. Tastes good hoppy beer. Little yeast. Hint of spices with a caramel finish. Good hoppy beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught @ Albion. Clear dark amber with copper tint, large creamy beige head, faint caramel aroma, low carbonation, bitterish caramel taste, medium finish. Felt generic but quite smooth

On cask at Rattle N Hum, NYC. Toasted toffee and apricot aroma with a white gummi bear accent. Almost clear bronze under white wisps and a thin ring. Sweet caramel flavour with apricot and pine hops, medium bitterness, and some lemon peel. Medium body, moderate to low carbonation, midway between smooth and crisp.

From the tap the pour is clear dark red not quite auburn, a bright red to orange hue in current lighting, Aroma is Light Hoppy citrus notes, taste is hops malts and a slight red apple sweetness, finish is malty with a medium mouth feel

Amber beer with a thin foamy off-white head. Rather strange nose of menthol, soap, perfume, and funk. Flavor is better with a nice malty caramel sweetness up front followed by a medium bitterness of spruce, pine, and resin. Rather thick on the palate, this is an unusual beer that grows on you.

Pine caramel hop aroma with some spice thrown in. Brown and amber clear colored body with only a thin head. Crisp and malt taste. Mild bitterness. Bold malt finish with a light caramel in the background.
on tap,poured into a pint glass..amber color with fluffy white head..aroma of pine,resin,caramel..crisp,bitter..decent stickiness...middle of the road.

Backlog.
Appearance: Clear amber body with a dense light tan head. Great retention.
Aroma: Herbal tea, light grapefruit and orange peel. Airy. Moderate strength aroma, leans mildly bitter.
Taste: Intro is light with malts with overlying dry airyness. Hop presence builds to grapefruit and orange with some floral overtones. Bready malts underneath. Dry quick finish.
Palate: Crisp with moderate carb.
Overall: Nice amber ale, clean and brewed well. Could use more modern hops.
On tap at Tap-House Munich. Amber with a huge head. Caramel nose followed by mild citrus-caramel flavours. Quite nice.

Aroma bread, cereal, 
Appearance amber, clear, frothy, 
Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate light body, thin feel, average carbonation, 
Overall not great but not worth missing

Dude. You should definitely check this out. Aroma is lots of stone fruit: peaches, berries and a little citrus to round it out. Think mangosteen. For those of you whove never heard of a mangosteen, you know what to do--Google That S#!%. It has a nice sweetness that assimilates the fruity hop flavor. Its not particularly bitter... so if you want to warm your hop adverse friends up to the joys of hops...try this one...
On tap at the ABE airport. Its pretty good. darker amber body. Light fruity sweet aroma. Taste was similar. More sweet tastes than fruitiness. Its kind of like a baby Nugget Nectar.

Draught. Darker copper in color with a whitish head. Citrus fruityness behind that caramel malty and sweet tea leafyness in aroma. Malty sweetness with some bitterness in taste. Nice grassy hoppy finish.
Tap at Rattle & Hum, New York. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, floral, caramel, some sweetness and malts.
Pours a dark amber from a bottle. Aroma is a slight caramel, citrusy hops. Medium body. Nice bittersweet balance. Good beer.
Bottle pour clear copper with thin white head. Nose caramel malt and some dank hop. Taste similar to nose, more earthy and dank. Then some reasonable bitter mid to late.

Light amber, foamy. 
Medium body, strong but simple taste, refreshing mouthfeel, long, bitter finish. 
Very bitter, not well balanced in sweetness by the malt, despite its strong presence in the background. 
Hoppy but not resiny or citric, creme caramel background. . 
Good but not my favorite in this style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poura amber with white head. Caramel, hop, floral and malt aroma and flavors. Medium body and carbonation. Very crisp. Caramel and floral finish. Slightly oxidized.

Rated on 03-01-2013 at Troegs B.C. This draft beer has a small beige head with a long retention, copper transparent body, no visible carbonation observed, and a fair amount of lacing. The aroma is citrus hops, light spice and caramel malt. The flavor is lightly bitter, light spice, citrus hops, semi-sweet, and caramel malt. The mouthfeel is smooth and this beer is medium bodied. The hops are upfront in the aroma and flavor of this beer, but not overly so. This beer is very tasty and worth trying.

Draught @ Tap-House, Munich. Pours a dark amber copper colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of red berries, caramel, some harsh graininess and bread. Flavour of crisp floral hops, citrus, grains, some mild yeastiness, berries and bready malts. Medium bodied. Quite sweet finish with harsh bitterness. Decent.

Pours a reddish amber with a one finger off white head with decent lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine, caramel, sweet malts, and some light bready malts. Taste is similar to the aroma. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi-moderately bitter, medium-long finish. Overall, a tast, hoppy amber ale.

Golden pour, mild white head. Aroma is faint citrus, malts and hops. Taste is citrus, malts finishing dry with some spice. Subtle hints of caramel and pepper. Mild hop bitterness left behind. All works well together. Very good.

Draught @ Rattle N Hum, New York
Pours dark orange with a smooth head. Aroma of sweet caramely malts, toffee, mild fruity notes and berries. Taste is sweet, malty and fruity with some berries. Finish is sweet, syrupy and malty with notes of berries and fruits. Decent.

Bottle. Clear dark gold, almost brown, very nice color. Aroma is bread crust and floral hops. The taste adds mellow sweet hops and a hint of spiced caramel. Medium bitter mouthfeel. Overall, a very nice afternoon hoppy amber. Solid and balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Not impressed the troeg's nugget nectar is much better. With a name like hopback I was expecting the hop aroma to slam me in the face but the aroma wasn't very strong. Maybe my keg was aged. The color also was light for an amber ale. Good malty flavor but a bit full on mouthfeel for how I like my hoppy beers. Taste was ok. Not very hop forward. More malty/balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz bottle pours an amber color without much head. Rich malty flavor with some sharp hop flavors that are a little like cough medicine.

Tap. Cloudy red Amber, Guinness head. Vietnamese basil and earthy hop aroma, light roasted caramel notes, good grassy and herbal backend with staying power. Chewy medium body, light sparkly. Imperial bitter ;)
Tremendous Beer. Troegs nailed this one. Hopback has a great mix of hops and more hops

BOD 8/15/14. Clear amber pour with just a hint of dark ruby. Very nice head with exceptional lacing and very good retention. Nice light nose of blended hops, mostly pine with herbal notes, over a somewhat dominate caramel base. As it warms, light spicy hop notes are present. Light medium bodied with a nice slightly oily texture. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence on the finish. Very well balanced flavor profile with a bit of complexity and quite good intensity for an amber ale. It begins with a blend of hop flavor that transitions to mostly pine as the bitterness begins to creep in. Beneath all of this, is a good caramel backbone that takes center stage as the mild bitterness releases into the finish. The finish is slightly sweet over a mild pine oriented bitterness with a touch of pepper like spice.

Rich amber/copper color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of floral hops, caramel malt, & some spice; Flavor of sweet malt, caramel, hops, and citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; Pretty good.
caramel, cereal, floral, citrus, amber, minimal head, light sweetness, light spiciness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, slightly bitter.
Tap, amber pour, white head, nose is caramel, taste is caramel, hoppy, bitter, like a pale ale.

Pours a light amber with a foamy white head. Aroma is light syrup and floral hops. Taste is mildly sweet with a subtle sharp bite in the finish. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle & on tap. Pours a nice orange amber, off white thin head. Aroma is caramel and bready malt, floral hop, light pine, toffee. Flavor is med/ full sweet, malty, but finishes with a nice bitter hop profile not typical of most ambers. Medium body, sweet and hop.
Bottle. Pours an amber color with white head. Caramel, herbal, hop aromas. Caramel, floral, hoppy, bitter, herbal flavors. Really solid amber ale.
Poured 12oz bottle from mix pack, pours a clear amber with a thick white head, aroma had some pine and hop aroma with a smooth flavor of a mixture of malt and a hop finish. Simple but nice.

Draft at some little place in one of the terminals at National Airport in DC. Amber pour with a slight white head. Big floral hop character in the taste and nose. Slightly bitter and strong malt finish. Solid.
Lighter, even for an amber ale, and decidedly reserved for an aggressively hopped beer. Aromas of hop flower, bitter melon, resin and paper.
Bottle courtesy of Bruce, thanks! Hazy amber color, small white head. Aroma of caramel and grass. Taste is smooth caramel at first, then floral pine and fruit.

nice beer from Summer SS. I still think most of these highly rated ambers are more apa than amber, but this was a good beer - some toffee/caramel in aroma and taste. plenty of hops but this was well balanced; much sweetness with good non bitter hops. well done!
Tap sampler at Troegs in Hershey, PA. Plenty of hops detected on the nose and taste. Maybe overdone with respect to hop saturation.

Keg at Munich Taphouse, squeezed a mini session into 15 minutes, before catching plane, 24th July 14, this was mixed in rapid succession with Nugget Nectar and 3 Floyds Pantzer Wolf, tough acts to follow, however this is solid and a pleasant amber.

On draft at DCA airport.

The beer is transparent with a bronze / golden body and a half inch of white head. The aroma brings piney hops, bready malts. Good flavor, with a mild sweetness to balance the robust pine component. Medium bodied with moderate bitterness. A solid beer from a fresh keg. Tasty.

On tap at Ledo. Pours a clear dark orange/copper with active carbonation. Lasting rocky head is a light off white cream. Aroma is ale breadiness, malt, and mild hop bitterness. Flavor is same with full creamy mouthfeel and active carbonation.

Transfer from BA review on 4-20-12 - 
Served on cask in a pint glass

Appearance  Served a medium golden-orange color with a large white head. The head faded moderately fast giving way to a light amount of lacing.

Smell  The aroma is of some caramel and more citrus hop in nature. Mixed with the heavier aromas there are lighter biscuit and piney hop aromas as well.

Taste  The breadiness is the first to meet the tongue. There is a lighter caramel sweetness at first, that intensifies to the middle of the taste. When the caramel really comes into play nice citrus hop flavors meet the tongue. These soon take over the taste and mix with some good pine hop. At the very end there is still a very light caramel sweetness in the bready backbone, but the hops dominate the stage and leave a crisp bitterness on the tongue.

Mouthfeel  Being on cask the carbonation was a bit on the lower side. This gave a very creamy body feeling on the tongue and really allowed, at first the sweet flavors to really be experienced, but later allowed for the smoother hop flavors to sit on the tongue and linger. It was very satisfying.

Overall  This is a very nice cask beer. The mouthfeel from the cask pour really accentuated some of the nice taste qualities of the beer. It was delicious.
One of the better ambers Ive had. Light red. caramel with some subtle spicing and a good amount of bittering hops. Tried at the DC Drink the District Derby Days with Matt and Justin.
Piney hop nose, poured from 12oz bottle with at least two fingers of foam. Deep amber color. Some grapefruit, medium body, bitter finish. Better than I remember.

Tap House Munich. On tap. Promising copper color, nose of hops and caramel. Complex taste with many different flavors, yet the aftertaste is a bit too bitter. Still an interesting beer with many facades.
This is a nice beer. Modest, not overly hopped as are too many American beers. Very drinkable with food or on its own.
Clear amber color with white head. Aroma of citrus and toast. Resin, orange, pineapple. Well hopped. Roast and dryness in the finish. Some alcohol.

(draught) pours a clear amber-ruby colour with a frothy light beige head. aroma of tropical fruit and caramel, slightly sweaty and quite resinous, with a hint of nettles and banana. flavour is more tropical fruit and resin, with some sugar icing, herbal hops, orange peel and a hint of alcohol in the medium-bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Reviewed from notes.
I had this in a pint glass.
The appearance was a gentle dark amber color with a nice level foamy one finger head with an adequate foamy lacing sticking finely to the sides of the glass.
The smell had a decent amount of caramel malts up front and lets a gentle amount of bitter citrus hops coming in slightly as the beer warmed.
The taste was bitter and sweet ranging at somewhat different times but ends up combining more as the beer warmed. The aftertaste was really nice as it was pure bittersweetness altogether. The finish was somewhat dry but still had a nice backing by the hops and malts.
On the palate, it sat about a medium in body and had a decent sessionable quality to it.
Overall, I say this was a pretty good American Amber well worthy of having again.
UPDATED: MAY 26, 2014 Draft beer at a pub. Good hop aroma with a subtle background of malt. The taste is balanced, just a little bit heavy on the hop bitters.

On tap at the brewery, served in a tasting glass. Pours clear copper with a small tan head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has notes of caramel and toffee, along with delicate lemon and citrus, grass and a touch of pine. The flavour is moderately bitter throughout with mostly pine notes but some grass; this is paired with caramel malty and grainy notes for balance. The finish is long and hoppy with a moderate delicate bitterness. On the palate it is medium in body with a smooth, watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall, a decent amber ale but the hops could be more complex. 2014-04-27

12oz bottle. Filtered orange-copper body. Foamy, frothy off-white head. A pretty decent amber, but not really hoppy enough to put hop in the title if you ask me. Still pretty much a malt showcase, with a decent amount of depth attached to the amber malt. Caramel malt. Pretty decent Amber I guess.
This is a slight disappointment. Almost not sure if it wants to be an amber or an IPA.

Good hop aroma with a subtle background of malt. Hop and malt are pretty well balanced. The texture is good with some butter cut by hop acidity. The taste is balanced, just a little bit heavy on the hop bitters.

malty and wheaty in the aroma unusual and inviting maybe some floral or piney hops in the back..off white head much lacing amber brown color looks good..tastes of caramellish malts and smoothness at first a bit of fruitiness in the middle and tingly hop bitterness back there somewhere  strong for the abv and complex as well..palate is smooth and easily drinkable lioghtly carbonated full bodied..overall a big surprise very heavy and complex for 6 percent more malty than hoppy but in this case a good thing
Somewhat smooth, liked the smell and taste. Keep an open mind when trying. Has a bitter after taste. Its good!

12 ounce bottle. Hazy amber orange color. Fluffy beige head. Sweet caramel malt nose balanced with a floral hop aroma. Bittersweet caramel malt flavor with hints of vanilla, cinnamon and black pepper. Lots of spicy bitter hops here too. Very nicely done.
Amber colored with a clean white head.  Hoppy aroma with a somewhat spicy taste and after taste.

Location/Date:Bottle on June 1st, 2012.
Appearance: Pours medium copper. 
Aroma: Aroma of herbal hops, malt.
Taste: Caramel malt, medium light bitterness.
Palate:Medium light body.
Summary: I enjoy amber ales, and this one is a great example of the style.
Draft.  Amber pour with nice head.  Caramel, citrus, nice balanced bitterness, hop.  Overall a nice balanced beer but a bit body would make this a great beer.
Ive always really like this beer.  Theres nothing really special about it, but it always just saticifies me.

Amber and fairly cloudy.  Not much head.  The aroma has some mild hops and caramel.  The palate is more caramel and some light bitterness.  A bit chewy.  Medium-dry finish, fairly standard mildly hoppy amber like Ive had a thousand times.

poured from bottle into a pint glass. Pours a copper/amber color with a small head.

Very good and complex aromas of citrus, hops, cinnamon, and malts. Excellent depth with real balance on the aromas as well.

Medium bodied with a very nice feel, but lacking a slight bit on the mid. Balanced with flavors of hops, cinnamon and citrus.

this was from a late december bottling. This held up very well and was very enjoyable
Not much aroma, due to fresh freezing pour off draft. Amber body, clear and fresh taste. Not a lot of citrus going on, fantastic hop profile.
Smells very hoppy but not overly so. The color is absolutely perfect for an amber. Taste is hoppy and a little bit citrus. Overall very good beer.

Originally reviewed: 6/9/09. Pours a deep amber with an inchs worth of ivory head on top. Excellent retention and it leaves some nice pretty lacing rings on the glass edge. Smells of hops and caramelly malts and breads. 

The mouthfeel could be a little crisper on this. Carbonation is low to medium level. The hops on this are not overpowering by any means. They leave a subtle hop bite on the finish, but its tamed out by a nice sweet malt base. This is a well-done amber, I must say. I could drink a few of these at a time.

Bottle. Bronze, clear body with a small white head. Nose of herbal, rootsy hops and toffee. I'd have called this a full bodied American pale ale if they didn't say it was an amber. Whatever the style is, it's flavorful without dominating the palate. Nice.

Bottle, from Marsonthemoon. Dark amber, muddled, with scant head and no lacing. There is too much of the caramel and cardboard box, with only a hint of dull resinous hops in the finish. Uninspired and tedious.
Very bitter and tart - makes you pucker a little! Some piney notes. Strong aroma. Rich amber color, with a medium head.

Wow.. aroma is fantastic!  Maybe one of the best aromas from a bottled beer- sweet malt and fruity hops.  taste was a bit of a letdown compared to the aroma, but still good.  Caramel malt and bready/toasty at first, finished by a fairly firm bitterness for an amber (although, I suppose, not for one named hopback, but nonetheless I wish they backed down by a few IBUs).

12oz into a pint.  I wish all amber ales were like this.  Color is a dark amber with shades of brown and dark purple.  Head is medium, laces the glass then is scatterd about the top of brew in no particular pattern.  Smell is malty, then hoppy, then sweet.  Taste is hoppy, fresh citrus, sweet caramel, and earthy grains within the hops.  Theres that hop bite that brings me back for another refreshing indulgence that I love the most.  An excellent brew. One to try in a sampler or a sixer, this is great.
Pours a clear red with a foamy tan head.  Smells citrusy, a bit like pine and grapefruit.  Taste is mildly sweet, moderately hop bitter.  Crisp and refreshing.

Bottle.  For a style that most of the time is pasted by this offering is quite a nice beer and a really nice amber.  Amber color with a small white head. Aroma is very malty with mild hops and some light spiciness.  Flavor is the big malty up front followed by a medium dose of hops. As said good, but great for the style.

A very well balanced beer, not nearly as hoppy as the name would lead you to believe (for that try Troegs Nugget Nectar, which is awesome). Starts malty and sweet, maybe with some mild caramel notes, and transitions about halfway through to resiny hops. Good but not great.

Bottle.  Slightly hazy, mostly clear dark amber beer with a medium lasting off-white head.  Sweet , very malty aroma of caramel, some honey, and a little hops.  Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, with some spice.  Finish is very bitter.    Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, somewhat sticky texture.

Bottle. Trade from Ramy. Thanks!! It pours bit hazy amber with a medium off white head. The aroma is hoppy and flowery with notes of caramel and malt. The flavour is quite malty and caramelish with lots of flowery hoppy notes like citrus and berries. Bitter hoppy finish.

Brief write up. Generally, Im not a amber ale kind of person, but this ones a notch above most others thanks to its generous, but not overdone hop profile. Its piny finish helps make this one pretty interesting. In particular, the mouthfeel of this is top notch; creamy smooth without being too thick, featuring subtle dryness on the finish. Quite good considering I dont like the style.

My first time really trying to pick out the flavors and aromas of a beer, I have tried tons of beers, but never really say there to see if I could pick out its individual flavors. With that said, This is a pretty good beer,  A slight taste of bitterness from the hops, but quickly overtaken by the sweet malt. Nice dark amber color and smells pretty earthy. Overall I think its a pretty good beer. Nice and crisp.
Pours a see-through dark brown. Smells of flowers spice and caramel hops. Thin body. Good bitterness. Lots of hops

Pours a deep, somewhat hazy, amber with a small to medium head.  It has a citrus/floral hops aroma with a hip of roast malt.  Light to medium bitterness.  The body is very light with a crisp, clean, but slightly sticky texture.  There is average carbonation, and it has a nice bitter finish that keeps you wanting more.  This is a tasty beer and quite unlike any amber ale I have ever had.  It it more like an IPA.  I would almost pay bar price for this in bottle or tap, and if I didnt see anything else in the pub that struck my interest I would certainly order a few of these.

Extra from a trade.  Nose is mild floral hops and some caramel malt.  Medium head and lacing.  Dark amber color with a little cloudiness.  Sweet malt front and a crisp finish.  Really enjoyable, solid brew.  Great with my roast beef sandwich and horseradish on an early spring day.
Couleur ambrée croustillante avec une signature florale, très fraiche. Buvabilité morbide.

Red color with a half finger off-white head with pretty good retention. Smells very earthy, malt almost more prominent than bittered hops, bread yeast, amber malt and caramel. Taste of amber malt, light pine hop flavor and a light citrus hop flavor.

Bottle into a goblet. Pours honey light brown with a nice head. Taste is a hoppy, citrus, malt taste. Co2 is very high, so itd a great mouth feel. After taste is hop over malt with a bitter finish. Very good beer.

From notes.
Pours a nice dark honey orange with a nice frothy off-white head.
The nose is nice and hoppy, floral and citrus notes are pretty prevalent. Just a bit of sweetness to.
Very nice flavors, big citrusy hop characters that are nicely balanced out by sweet malt. Nice mouthfeel, very crisp, bitterness at the back of the mouth lingers for a pretty long time.

Review #1
Served On: 6/23/2011
Glassware: Plastic Cup

Enjoyed on tap from a 16oz plastic cup last night at Sovereign Bank Stadium (PA Road Warriors Vs. York Revolution). Ive had this beer before from a 12 oz. bottle, but it was a few months beyond the best-by date (as with many craft beers from the local distributors here). 

Look: Deep copper with a resiny appearance as it swirled in the glass (plastic cup). Head was present but dissolved within a few minutes. Lacing was nice and consistent. 

Smell: Noticed some sweeter malts at first  then became more hop-forward as it sat (almost like an IPA).

Taste: A sticky mount feel with the malts hitting the tongue first. Hops followed with some citrus bitterness to balance with the initial malts. Finish seemed to maintain the bitterness. I found this to be unusual for an amber ale. But it was nice.

This is a solid beer that follows suit with other Tröegs beers Ive had. The extra hoppiness was certainly a bonus here. I noticed the same surprise in Tröegs Pale Ale.

Serving type: on-tap

a: rubyamber color, nice frothy head with pretty good retention. Reduces to lacing and rings around the glass

s: citrus hop aroma hits like a sledgehammer, hint of caramalized malt

t: carmel malts not as much hop flavor as I was expecting from the smell. I notice a bit of pine taste.

m&d: smooth and pretty well balanced. medium bodied, this beer is an awesome session brew.

Dark amber with a foamy head that leaves lots of lace. Smells of of malt and grassy hops give this beer a nice aroma. Taste of sweet malts and floral, citrus hops are in balance with a medium body mouth feel.

7/II/2012 12Fl. Oz. bottle from Canal Liquors Mt. Ephraim (NJ) @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: VI/26/11 (2012-110) 
Clear reddish amber beer, creamy yellowish head, unstable, adhesive with nice lacing. Aroma: very fruity, peaches, passion fruits, sweet apples and pears, bit dusty, some sugar. MF: ok carbon, medium body, creamy texture. Taste: fruity start, lychee, green apples, bitterness, sour touch. Aftertaste: dry and bitter, some honey malts, grassy.

Draft at Market Cross Pub in Carlisle, PA. Copper color. Poured a thick head. Caramel, some citrus hops in aroma. Medium bitter. Med light bodied, on oily textured side. Also slightly creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Caramel, citrus hop, and some lite biscuit bread.
