An excellent beer, period. Very hoppy and malty as well. Slight notes of caramel, maybe some spice. Well done Troegs!
Caramel and hops in the aroma.  Caramel/toffee, bread, and spice in the flavor, followed by a nice hop bite.  Really, really good.

Draft.  Nice clear copper color.  Poured a thicker head than most ambers.  Caramel, some citrus hops in aroma.  Medium bitter.  Med light bodied, on oily textured side.  Also slightly creamy texture.  Soft carbonation.  Caramel, citrus hop, and some lite biscuit bread.  I like it.

Bottle. The aroma was a slight doughy with a clean muted hop finish. The tight head gave off a thick initial lacing that diminished as I drank. The dark amber body was slightly translucent with a burnt orange sheen. A medium bodied palate complimented the amber bottomed taste, heavy and sweet caramel, with the bitter hop sitting on top. Its a sandwich of a beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy by rsully

This is my go to beer most of the time at home. Has some caramel and citrus notes in the aroma. Pours a dark copper color with a small to medium off white head. Taste of malted caramel and citrus with maybe even a hint of piney notes in the background.

A - Hops and Malt
A - Nice dark amber
Taste - smooth
Palate - Medium to full body 
Overall I loved this beer, will keep a case on hand
Pours a clear dark copper color with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of sweet caramel malts and grassy hops. Flavor of caramel malts, floral and citrus hops. Pretty good.

Nice refreshing go to ale.  Medium to light body with lively carbonation.  A nice balance of malts and hops make this very drinkable and tasty.  The hop character is what make the beer with nice spicy piney elements.

Draught. Pours a dark amber with a thin white head. Smells of floral hops and caramel. Tastes of flowers and huge caramel. Medium bodied. Syrupy texture. Medium carbonation. Finishes dry. Initially fantastic, but wanes quickly.

Tap at Fourth Avenue Pub in Brooklyn w Erica. Pours dark red-amber with small head and no lacing. Aroma is wet hops and popcorn* with a bit of light pine. Palate is wet hop-forward with notes of candy, grapefruit and orange peel. Wet, swishy, good.

*full disclosure: Erica was shoving a basket of the bars free popcorn into my face throughout the duration of the tasting.

12-oz. Thanks, Bob! Pours a crystal clear medium amber with very little tan head. Sharp onion and pine nose, appealing enough. Light body, soft carb. Toasty oatmeal mid palate with a mildly sweet pine finish.

On tap at Matchbox, Rockville.  May not have been super fresh, the hops just werent there as much as I expected.  Its smooth enough, refreshing, but the hop kick seemed to be missing.  Stay tuned, will try again...
Nice amber color on pour and a wonderful citrus, floral, caramel blend to the flavor. Love the taste blend on this one!! Another big win for Troegs!

12oz bottle from Wegmans in State College, PA. Pours a crystal clear, amber colored body with a finger-width, frothy, egg-shell white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is well hopped with a nice malt backing. Caramel, cereal grains, and toasted bread with plenty of florals and a moderate pine with some citrus grapefruits and tropical fruits. Flavor is similar. Cereal grains, toast, and caramel up front with a solid hopping. Pines, florals, and a nice grapefruit-tropical fruit mix. Finishes with some bready toast and caramel as well as a nice hopping that gives this a moderate bitterness before drying and leaving a fairly lengthy aftertaste. Light body with a moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty solid beer. Nice bready caramels and toast with a solid hopping that stays balanced throughout. Very clean and enjoyable.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2011 Bottle.  Pours Amber, 1 fginger head, good lacing throughout.  Fairly hoppy aroma, obviously the younger brother of Nugget Nectar.  Sweet tropical fruit. Citrus fruit and Noble hops up front balanced with caramel malt, a bit of spice, brown sugar.  Medium Body, Medium Carbonation.  A good opening act before tackling a Nugget Nectar and works great as a session or one you could drink 6 of with ease.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Bright amber with thin off-white head and spotty lacing.

Aroma: Hoppy aroma that seems to be a mix of spicy noble hops and some type of citrus. Strong caramel aroma as well.

Taste: Dried-out caramel and biscuit malt backbone with laeyrs of hop goodness on top - citrusy, floral and spicy. Ends lightly bitter.

Palate: Pretty smooth medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Nice dry finish.

Overall: Certainly one of the better Amber Ales out, and flat out perfect as a great, everyday ale.

Bottle courtesy James - thanks!  Pours dark amber with a scattering of tan foam.  Aroma is faded hops and sweet, caramel malt backbone.  Taste follows the aroma with a thin, watery feel in the mouth.  Okay beer.

Deep transparent amber color. Smells hopped like a pale and a little doughy, does not reveal whats to come. Taste is a blast of raw florists shop. Reminds me of Harpoon IPA, but with more malt. Solid stuff.
On draft at Forebay in the Hershey Lodge.  A rich hoppy amber ale mellowed with caramel notes.  Easy to session year round.
very nice amber decent hop aroma and flavor. light head and surprise amber in color

Served on cask into a nonic pint at Als of Hampden. This version has 3x palisade hops.
A - Pours dark amber with a small one finger head, dissipating to a light film of head, leaving faint rings of lacing down the glass.
S - If you think the normal version of hopback is hoppy then you aint seen nothing yet. This one is HOPPY, like the normal version but on hoppy steroids. Huge amounts of grassy, piney, citrus hops. A touch of sweetness from the malt is a welcome addition and helps add some contrast to the nose.
T - An absolute wall of grassy hops up front giving way quickly to a touch of caramel malt sweetness and a bit of dryness from the yeast. Finish is plenty of hop bitterness that lingers for only a short time because it is washed away by the thin, watery, feel. Very nice flavors but the thin finish ruins it a bit. If it wasnt so thin I would say this is the best hopback I have ever had but I just cant do that with how it is.
M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. The feel was a bit on the watery side which I didnt like too much. Lingering hop bitterness in the finish but it does not linger on the pallet for very long.
D - Fairly high. I love the normal version of hopback, and I have had this on cask a few times before, but the watery feel brought this one down a notch. I still think it is the best cask hopback I have ever had.

Tellers (Hyde Park Cincinnati) Beer Dinner.  Medium amber, good , long-lasting head and lace.  Crystal toffee-malt with a medium strength bitter citrus hopping.  Good balance with the hops giving way to the malt at the finish.  Solid ale.
35cl Bottle, thanks Harmen&Kevin! Clear amber colour, white head. Aroma of floral hops, light sweet malts, caramel. Flavour is sweet, caramel, floral, light bitter finish. Light bodied. Nice.

Bottle at Ulysses Folk House.
Pours amber with a light tan head.
Hoppy brew and very drinkable.

Nice hop aroma in the nose.  Pours a deep, crystal clear amber.  No head.  Nice mouthful of hops along with a healthy malt backbone.  Im getting a little caramel along with the spicy hops.  This is a good beer.
Aroma is a sweet malt with some grain. Taste is a sweet grassy hop, but not overly bitter. Overall a nice balance.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2013 Long overdue Re-rate. Draft at craft ale house. Pours clear copper with a medium sized off tan head. The aroma has a mix of caramel, some sugary notes, light hop presence but not distinct. The taste has a nice caramel sweetness with a resiny hop balance. Not bitter, not overly in any direction but enjoyable.

Smooth spicy, sugary aroma. Has the appearance of clear copper brew with off white head and lots of lacing. A great balance of citrus-pine hops and malt and caramel. Tasty drinker. Yes please, Ill have another.

A: Copper/amber body... good carbonation.. medium off-white head which disappears shortly after forming.. good lacing.

S: Floral/grassy hops... some citrus hop character as well... nice spice to it but little malt backbone.

T: Not quite there... decent hop forward taste which is met with a bland malt base... no flavor or bitterness in the finish.

M: Medium bodied and slightly resiny but simultaneously watery thin in places.

O: Taste just isnt there to carry this beer for me (review from 2008)
bottle in Virginia. very good beer, great smell and hoppy taste, nice palate and color.

one of the few memorably good beers from Troegs.  citrussy-pine hop aroma well backed by rich amber malt tones. good translucent ruby-brown color with sloshy marshallowy head.  good lacing.  rich malt sweetness holds up the body and the flavor while hop bitterness and aroma leave the palate clean and the senses refreshed and satisfied.
Cask, 5.8%, dry hopped with simcoe. Grassy hop aroma. Hazy red amber colour, no head. The flavour is hoppy, slightly grassy, a bit sweet. Well-balanced. Low carbonation, probably because of the cask.

Draft at The Pour House in Westmont, NJ.

Podarks dark amber/ruby red color with golden orange edges and 1.5 finger frothy white head.  Excellent retention slowly fading into lasting cap that coats the glass with soapy lacing on its way down.  

Earthy hop aroma with grassy/piney notes that are very nicely countered by the sweet malt presence.  Hints of caramel and biscuit.  

Full bodied for the style with an excellent balance of earthy, bitter hops and sweet malt flavors.  Hops are prominent with a dry and bitter piney, grassy presence that lingers into a dry finish.  Countered by hints of caramel, rye, toffee and biscuit.  Flavorful, well balanced and very quaffable.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours clear amber with 3/4" beige head.  Little lacing, heavy body, low carbonation, and sticky texture.  Taste is caramel malt, some grapefruit, and finishes piney bitter.  Not a fan  of the pine.

12 oz bottle, 6% a/v

Bright copper pour with a nice light tan head. The aroma is hoppy, caramel, and a little citrus. The taste is also very hoppy but the caramel and slightly toasty malt balances it out. The hops are citrusy but also a little spicy, very nice! The mouthfeel is very nice and full leaving a lingering and delicious hopback flavour! Another great beer from Troegs

UPDATED: APR 22, 2014 Bottle. Pours copper with good lasting soft head and some lace. Smells and tastes of english malts, fresh soap, spicy hopes with a bit of...metal. Feel is fresh, soft but watery with a bit of metal.  Fairly well rounded and easy drinking. A bit common all around but good for that.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine in Norfolk, VA.  Pours dark orange with a creamy off-white head.  Citrusy hop aroma, pineapple and tangerine, mostly with faint sweet malts in the background.  Very nice citrus hop flavor, again with pineapple and this time some grapefruit.  More hop forward than many amber ales.  For me, this would rank near the top of this style.

Tasted,rated on 7/4/11. Amber pour with thick head,leaves nice lacing in glass,aroma as expected is spicy and hoppy,but I can pinpoint nice carmel malt aroma as well. Flavor of piney hops and caramel malts,medium mouthfeel with a slight bitter finish.

Pint @ Stanton Public, NYC. This was pretty much everything I want in an amber ale. This is a clean, very filtered beer with a juicy, crisp and fresh hops taste that is balanced nicely with hops flavors that give this beer caramel, oats and brown sugar notes. Perfectly bodied; not too hard to put down, but not watery.

From the bottle. It pours copper with an orange head. The aroma is very hoppy with some citrus, heavy peach and some pine. Nice malts with touches of dark fruit. The flavor is very tropical with papaya, peach, come pine and a touch of toasted malt. Lacks a citrusy punch in the finish, but very nice. Good balance in this one, especially for an amber ale.

Bottle. Poured amber with an off-white head that settled to a ring and left good lace. Aroma of citrus and floral with a light malt backing. The flavor found caramel, toasted malt, and a light citrus and floral. Medium body and a lasting light bitterness.
Pours a copper color with minimal head. Aroma of spices and hops, and tastes of bitter hops but not too strong. Really good.

Indeed amber, on the darker side with small light tan head that lingers.  Aroma pretty much brown sugary malt with hop presence.  Medium body.  Flavor nice balance of hops and malt.  Oddly dry finish.  Not much to say, not that interesting but well made.
12 oz bottle pours a dark amber color with a off white head.  Aromas of sweet malt, caramel, and citrus.  Medium bodied with a sweet finish, a real nice amber

12oz bottle from the troegs Anthology variety 12-pack. Clear ambery-red color, minimal head and lacing. Spicy hop aroma, but not too strong. Sharpish carbonation, but good texture. Decent amber, but if this is as good as they get, then I guess I dont really find the style to be too interesting.
bottle, pours a nice yellow colour,taste was a nice bitter hoppy flavour, pours a nice strong hoppy smell, the taste was very enjoyable, thanks for the offering
Bottle. Poured light red/amber with small head that retained. Floral/slightly grassy hops dominate the aroma and flavour. Smooth, dry, hoppy finish.
Draft @ the brewery. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus finish.

Poured from bottle. Aroma is dark caramel malts with a touch of hops tingling in the background. Appearance is a dark amber with a dark beige, almost grey, head. Solid lacing. Taste is initially a peat note, somewhat like ground pepper. This has a toasty quality to it as well. Slightly dry and sweet, but nowhere near cloying. Medium bodied. Superbly balanced beer. I could drink a barrel of this stuff.
probably shouldnt be in this style as it was much more flavourful than an Amber. nice floral hops with caramel maltiness. drinkable and refreshing. very good beer.
Bottle. Surprised this isnt an IPA, although its not extremly hoppy like hop devil< Amber brown color< Smells of cereal, bread and herbs. Really interesting and enjoyable

Ruby red-brown, beige cover.  Aroma is expected toffee, caramel, spicy, herbal hops.  Taste is quite similar, a bit more floral hops, a slight candy sweet edge to the finish.  Sadly I think this is a beer style that just does not lend itself to being truly phenomenal.  So, to quote a Cream Ale reviewer, "Its good, for an Amber Ale."

Bottle. Cloudy amber body. Short, frothy off-white head, rapidly diminishing. Malty aroma with floral notes. Raw grain, caramel, citrus, lemon. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture turning sticky in the finish, lively carbonation. Beer is reminiscent of Alpha King without the big hop profile.
Deep copper color with a thin white head. Aroma of caramel malt and piney hops. Rich somewhat full body with a balanced sweetness from the crystal malt. Really solid amber ale.
Pour copper armber white haed. Aroma carmel, citrus fruit, pine, nice hops. Taste caramel, citrus, grapefruit, nice malt backbone,  MF medium chewy body good carb. Tasty easy drinker well done.

Bottle. Ap4 Pours clear amber ruby with nice off white head, retained and laced. A 8 Aroma sweet toffee, apricot, pine, citrus. T 8 Medium body, medium bitterness balanced well with a caramel sweetness, P 4 semi-dry finish with lingering bitterness. O 18

Aroma is a little weak, there is only a slight amount of bitterness. Nice amber ale with the taste of citrus and hints of hops.  Well balanced, smooth finis.  One of my favorites because of the hop flavor.

This is one my favorites. When I have this on tap at home I cant stop
drinking it. Very dangerous brew.

12oz bottle. Dark amber (bordering on brown) pour with a frothy tan head that recedes slowly. Nice balance of piny and floral hops with caramel and slightly roasted malt on the nose.  The roasted notes come out more on the palate with the hops taking on a resin quality. A good bitter finish.

Deep clear amber. Very complex aroma - pine, orange, floral, green apple. Body is between light and medium. Very nicely balanced, if not a little bit watery. Nice bitterness on the finish for an amber.

Vollmundig hopfiger Antrunk mit deutlicher Hintergrundherbe. Der Hopfen stumpft etwas ab und verliert an Volumen, ist aber weiterhin der stärkste Ton. Hier scheint das Bier mehr auf Süffigkeit ausgelegt, auch die Herbe wird milder, das Bier ist nun weniger aromatisch und kaum noch etwas Besonderes. Zum Schluss malzig-herb, einen Ticken säuerlich. 10/10/8/8/11/8

Has a nice orangeish color with some pine needle aromas.  A bit sweeter than expected but has a nice bitter balance that I like.  Very good amber ale.  Thought it was actually an ipa with its hop content.
12 oz bottle from sherm1016..thanks!  pours a cloudy amber with thin head that quickly leaves.  Hoppy nose and mild hoppy taste...hoppier than your usual amber but not too much so.  Tasty......
Poured a slightly hazy amber color.  Aroma is very hoppy with some sweet malts and nutmeg.  Taste is also quite hoppy with some resin and sweet malts.  The balance is good and it is flavorful.

Pours a clear amber with a thin white head.  Aroma is a beautiful piney hop, a little spice and a little malt.  Taste is a smooth pine hop bitterness with a good sweet malt and mild spice that blends with the hops very well.
Dark amber with thick white head and some lace.  Nice floral hops.  Very smooth.  Perfect for this time of year.

On Draft at RnH for Troegs Night with Streets, Linh, and Brendan. Pours a clear golden body with no head, some white lacing. Aroma is flowery and pine hops. Mouthfeel is thin - solid pine notes come out first in the flavor but then it finishes with an almost skunky, bitter caramel malt aftertaste.
Pour is a very light mahogany, crystal clear, light tan head quickly dissipating. Nose is of honey and light citrus. Taste is of varied light fruits and citrus. Very refreshing, well carbonated.
On tap at Pizza Daddies. Light citrus hops, caramel, black pepper I taste. Minimal head on deep amber. Light in the mouth, soft finish.

From notes: on tap at the Jet Rock Bar at the PHL airport. Pours a clear ochre color, with a slight head and nice lace. Slightly sweet, malt and yeast aroma. Full bodied with nice hop bitter flavor and traces of sweet citrus fruit. Balanced lingering aftertaste.

12oz bottle poured into a pint glass...Pours a medium copper with a light tan head, good retention and lacing...The aroma is piney, a little malt character, and alcohol, too much for a 6% beer...The taste shows off the hops again, too much pine for me. The pine is too much feel wise, but the hops are too bitter for me as well. A nice rye note tries to balance this out in vain. Way to much hops for me but still an enjoyable drink.

A - Pours a just clear deep amber color with hints of brown around the edges and a finger of frothy off-white head. The head fades slowly to a ring around the glass lacing nicely on the sides of the glass.

S - Aroma if full of deep sweet roasted caramel malts and some nice light citrus hops. There is also just a hint citrus fruits.

T - Starts off with a lot of sweet caramel malt flavor and some nice roasted notes. There is some light hop flavor and bitterness in the background. Through the middle more citrus hop flavor really comes out. The finish is a blend of citrus hops and roasted caramel flavor, with some nice sweetness, that lingers nicely.

M - Medium to medium-full bodied with moderate carbonation. Fairly smooth and crisp. Almost a touch creamy and the semi-dry finish is really nice.

D - Very drinkable. Excellent hop and malt blend and a very nice malt profile. Very crisp and refreshing while still having really nice flavors.

such an easy beer to drink, amber in color obviously, mostly hoppy, not as much as the nugget nectar which its belief that this is the son to nugget nectars father, and the flying mouflan is the grandad, but hoppy enough to be delicious, a little more malty than say a pale ale, and better because of it. really delicious.
pours red with a thin white head and lots of lacing.  light, hoppy and oddly milky aroma.  body is medium.  taste is hops and cherry. a good taste but simple.  dry, mildly bitter finish.

A nice deep red color with a thin off-white head.  Sweet notes dominate the nose.  I detected a sweet sugary maltiness in the aroma, very faint caramel, and even a bit of citrus.  This beer is lightly sweet at the beginning with a touch of bitterness at the finish.  There is moderate carbonation and thin medium body This is one of the most balanced beers I have had and it was  a pleasure to drink.

2/22/11. 12oz bottle. Slightly hazy amber pur with a nice fluffy off-white head that laces a ton. Huge fresh hop aroma with tropical fruits, pine, and caramel. More malt dominated flavor with caramel and nuttiness with hints of chocolate all with a swimming hoppy undertone of citrus and pine, especially pine and spice. Quite nice!

Bottle. Poured a cloudy copper-amber color with a finger and half width beige head. Its very hoppy and there is some caramel, yeast, and bread substance. Aroma is a little sweet, caramel, grapefruit. Taste is sweet, citrus, grapefruit, caramel...finishing with a flavorful of sweet bread.
On tap at pickles. Amber with quarter inch white head. Aroma is grapefruit. Flavor is grapefruit and honey. Nice.

From tap at Jacob Wirth. Pours clear and golden deep orange to brown with a small, white and creamy head. Aroma is fruity hoppy, slight caramelish malty. Mild fruity, slight sweet malty and subdued bitter. Ends lingering fruity and slight malty. Peachy fruity finish.
Very drinkable perfectly balanced lighter version of the nugget nectar, the malts really come through nicely in the finish
Good, basically your average good ale, doesnt really stand out from the pack but who cares
Nice amber color with a balance taste. Pours a nice head. Lingers nicely. Not a lot of maltiness with subtle hop action.

Super creamy and spicy. So much complexity in the flavor profile. Reminiscent of an excellent British ale, but more hops and more oomph. Im actually more impressed with this than the Nugget Nectar. Flagship beer!

On tap. Poured a clear amber with an off-white head that dissipated almost completely. Aroma had a nice combination of bread, grain and a light pine hop note. Flavor began with bread and sweet grain and was joined by a nice pine hop in the finish to round out the beer.
Last one out of the 5gal. keg.  Clear blond/amber color.  Nice flowery aroma.  Crisp with slightly spicy finish.  Nice as mellow/well balaced as some other ambers.
Pours a nice amber color with little head.  Aroma is a little light with some hops and honey malt.  Smooth hoppy taste with a nice amber malt balance.

from Mondial de la BIère, Strasbourg - clear reddish-amber colour with a little chaotic foam left; correct lacework; fairly hoppy with notes of chewy malts and red fruit marmalade; slightly sticky and with a respectable malt body, fairly bitter and moderately dry; long malty and hoppy finish with notes of caramel and raspberries

One of my favorites, nice dark brown syrupy pour, has a nice sticky quality from the malts, but well hopped to set it off.  Nice bitter finish, perfectly balanced, some oak flavor in there as well, strong to very strong.
This beer is one of my new "gotos". If Im standing at the distributor and cant pick between two or three beers, ill just grab a case of this. Cant go wrong.

Tap. Coppery brown color with two fingers of slightly off-white head.  Zesty and fresh hops with some spice and citrus with light caramel in the aroma.  Very hop-forward Amber, and really tasty but balanced with the malt bill.  Bit oily, and tight carbonation.  Great drinking, and always great fresh.
An amber beer with a beige head. The aroma is sweet with notes of caramel and hops. The flavor is sweet and again dominated by caramel and hops

12 oz. bottle. Pours a deep amber color with a small white head.  The aroma is sweet caramel malts with moderate citrus and mild floral hop. The flavor is sweet caramel malts up front followed by a mild dose of citrus hops.  There is a slight hint of resin.  Nice for an amber in the sense that it shows more character.

Dark amber color with a white head. Aroma is floral and citrus hops but mostly a caramel sweetness.  Hints of pine. Medium sweetness and bitterness, very smooth.  There is a bitterness at the beginning but finishs sweet.  Nice well balanced beer, really enjoyed it.

Poured into a pint glass.

4.5 A: Really nice looking brew. Clear orange amber color. Two inches of dense head with above average retention and tons of lacing.

4.0 S: Loads of floral hop aroma going on. Grapefruity citrus and a bit of woodiness.

3.5 T: Pretty good, but lacks depth. Grapefruit citrus hops again, but not as pronounced as Id like. Seems to be some crystal malt, but malt character is minimal and makes the beer a bit unbalanced even though it isnt that bitter to begin with. Based on the nose, I expected a lot more. This is very much like a watered down Nugget Nectar.

3.0 M: Surprisingly light in body. Carbonation is lower than I would like. Very smooth, but that simply isnt enough.

3.5 D: This is Nugget Nectar after suffering from a debilitating disease for several years. Its not bad by any stretch, but it doesnt stand alone.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-09-2009 01:20:51

Smells like a fresh hop with hints of carmel.  My bottle was two months old so it may have lost some hop flaver but was still excellent.  Citrus front notes and sweet malty finish.  No burn which should be expected with a 6% beer.

Clear amber pour with a thin light beige head. Bountiful hops in the nose. A lot of citrus and pine, with an underlying caramel and fruity sweetness. Fruity sweet flavor, some notes of caramel and roast. Long piney bitter finish. Body is good, but a little flat. Possibly an old bottle, as Ive had this fresh from the brewery and it was fine. Very delicious. A nice twist on the traditional boring amber ale.

12 oz. bottle in a shaker.  Nice amber pour with minimal white head.  Low carbonation.  Strong floral aroma with a nice hop flavor, but not too overwhelming.  Either learning to like hops more or Troegs just does it really well. Excellent beer.

12 oz bottle. Pours an amber with a small creamy white head. Aroma is extremely hoppy for the amber style, lots of pine, some caramel and biscuit sweet doughy notes. Some citric fruits in there s well. Flavor starts with a strong piney and citric hoppiness. Picks up some sweeter fruit notes before a sweeter piney finish. Medium body and a sharper carbonation. Very nice, but more of an ipa amber hybrid, my technical side says too hoppy but my hop lover side says mmmmmmmm

Aroma: Little to none. Slight maltiness, but nothing much heree.
Appearance: Clear golden orange with a thick white head
Taste: Medium sweet tempered with a slight bitterness.
Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, with little carbonation and a hoppy finish.
Overall:  Drinkable, but nothing Id seek out.

Another surprise find in family members garage full of macros.  Taste is malty, and of caramel, and fruit, and plenty floral notes.  Standard amber and nice end to a 4 rate holiday party where expectations were zero.
Bottle courtesy of beerman6686, thanks daniel.  Taste is of caramel and well-balanced hops.  A nice amber, but nothing worth writing home about.
an average beer all around    medium amber color with a medium head    medium caramel aroma and taste    mild hop bitterness in finish while also being alittle sweet  a bit watery
Pours a dark red color with a medium white head. A very nice hoppy aroma; sweet caramel and fruity hops. The flavor is nice; rich caramel, sweet fruity hops, smooth and balanced. Nice.

six pack from whole foods. pours a crispy amber with a soft head. has a rooty, slightly sweet almost marshmellowish scent.  The initial hit to the palate is of tart hops that are barely prevelant as the more robust taste of that sweet maltines on the back end.. missing just a bit of complexity and interaction between hops and the malts but overall its a nicely put together brew... not the hottest chick at the bar but definitely worthy of a quick trip to the car!!

Pours a beautiful amber with a nice, small, off-white head.  Aroma is a sweet Carmel with piney hops.  Flavor is mostly caramel and hops.  Its very creamy, and the hops are well balanced.  The finish is only mildly bitter, and lingers for a bit.

On tap at The Office. Color is light amber red. Nose is heavy towards the malt sugar and caramel. Medium body with decent carbonation. Taste is well balanced with a slight hop bitterness and dried fruit with sweet malts.

This beer intrigued my friend pat and I when we were out Friday night beer shopping.  Drunken out of a bottle, the first smell was incredibly bold, the hops were shooting out of the bottle and into your nostrils.  First sip had me taken aback, the body was very full and had an amazing caramel hoppy flavor.  The beer was smooth and delicate to the palate, but still had a very strong taste.  Great beer with a complex flavor.

12oz bottle as an extra from Steeve.  Pours an opaque amber with a shy white head.  Nose is medium malt presence with orange, slight apricot, and citrus bitter hops.  Flavor is has definite citrus and orange rind with citrus presence and nice malt backbone.  Light to medium body; a very enjoyable amber and I really dont like ambers.

Well-chilled 12oz bottle poured into a snifter.  Pours a robust amber color with a slightly lacy, off-color head.  Head is dissapointing and dissapates way too quickly (multiple pours were made to be fair).  The strongpoint to this brew (pre-taste) is the hop aroma.  It has a fabulous, inviting aromatic quality.  The nose is rife with floral hop notes and a surprisingly crisp, fruity freshness.  Possible detection of caramel tones. Mouthfeel is somewhat lacking.  Its aroma belies a full body malty feel that is not there.  It is possible that the over-bittering is simply masking the malt flavor.  Taste is slightly sweet, a bit too strong on the bittering hops, and a bit too light on the finishing hops, however it is still a well-balanced brew and a worthwhile selection.

12oz bottle in a shaker.  Pours transparent amber with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of caramel malts and generic hops.  Flavor pretty good for an amber ale, stonger on the hops than most.  Average texture.  Pretty good beer.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2012 12oz bottle from Boulevard Super Liquors.  Pours a deep, dark amber color with a tan head.  Aroma is hoppy, some citrus, some Pine.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation  flavor is sweet, malty, a little Pine hops, with a light, bitter finish. Better than I remembered. Original rating: 11/30/2010: 5/3/5/3/14: Bottle in trade with Bmoyer0301.  Thanks!  Pours a dark amber with little to no head.  Aroma is a nice malty smell with a faint trace of hops.  Medium on the palate with medium carbonation.  Nice malty flavor with a little bit of hops, but not much.  Not a bad beer, but nothing special for me.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 G: Pint glass with a Black Bear (WV) logo printed on it.

A: Deep amber with a decent head and quality retention. Medium amounts of carbonation.

S: Malts and sweet amber. Plenty of hops; mostly floral and seemingly fresh--from the hopback?

T: Slightly sweet and definite amber malt flavor. A nice, fresh hop taste.

M: Slight carbonation and little alcohol sensation--goes down smooth.

D: Very drinkable. Glad Ill soon be moving out to VA and can get Troegs beers whenever I need them.

Nice! Dark brown pour with a thin white head that laced the whole glass. Aroma of hops. Taste of caramel and roasted malt until the swallow, then the hops grab the back of your throat and hold on. By the aroma youd think this beer was more hoppy, but it hides it well.Great full flavor and great balance.

Bottle.  Amber/dark brown color, small head, not much lace.  The aroma and flavor were both significantly hoppy for the style, which is why this is the top in its style.  Although they were both pretty hoppy, I feel like it was true to style as far as the amber malt backbone goes.  Overall: a tasty, easy session beer.

Bottle at White Rose in York, PA.  Tasty brew with loads of spices, caramel, and raw sugar in the nose to invite you to the first sip.  This is a smooth, creamy amber with depth of caramel malt flavor taken up several notches by the extra hopping.  Not the usual malt-to-hop ratio, but pleasant nonetheless.  Smooth and easy-drinking despite the characteristics of an APA.

Bottle from some little grocery store in Cincinnati, thanks UnclE JiM, via bro!  Pours a hazy tan/brown with little carbonation - 1/4 inch head.  Aroma is sweet fruity with a slight hop presence.  Taste is more mild that the aroma - somewhat malty, sweet, no hop throughout; not unpleasant but nothing outstanding.

12 oz bottle.  Appearance was goldish red with a nice light yellow head.  Aroma was of grass and caramel.  The taste was nice, with all the expected notes.  Carmel, floral, bitter hops, nice clean finish.  Overall, one of the best from Troegs.

Pours, well, amber colored and has a frothy white head with close-knit carbonation bubbles. Aroma is very balanced between the caramel malts and the hoppy bitterness with a tad of dirt/earth thrown in. Flavor is very smooth with just the right proportion of sweetness and bitterness. A session beer staple if there ever was one.

12 oz bottle.  Pours very amber in colour.  Aroma and taste a a nice balance of sweet caramel malt and floral, spicy hops.  Very sessionable.  I wish Id bought more.  Will get more on next trip over the border!
Sampled 10/29/10 on tap @ Landmark Tavern, Bouckville, NY.  Aggressively-hopped Amber Ale.  Aromatic, smooth & sessionable.  Looking forward to finding some of this to bring home for a proper review.

pint pour at Matt the Miller Tavern Dublin Ohio, 

Medium amber liquid clear, with a fine head of small bubbles.  Good medium hoppy aroma with some caramel malt.  Taste is a nice floral hoppy front kick resolving into a mellow medium malty happiness.  Quite a different ale.  Was described as a Hoppy amber ale which delivered quite well on the atypical description.  the Best of both worlds.  Very nice.

Perfect amber pour with thin white head.  Smells of earthy hops.  Taste starts the same and then evolves into a balancing clean malt sweetness.  A delightful session beer that leaves a dry hoppy residue on the palate from the slight bitterness.

As the name describes, the beer pours an amber brown with a quickly disappearing white head.  Good earthy hop smell to this craft, hints of caramel.  Nice hoppy start, with a malt finish. Very interesting taste. While definitely an Amber ale, the taste is distinct from others of the type.  Smooth beer with the right amount of carbonation, almost syrupy.  If ever there was a drinkable beer, it is this one. Goes down smooth with a good taste. The ABV is high enough to get you feeling good, without knocking you over.

12oz bottle pours a lively amber with a frothy head, great looking beer but lacking in aroma and complexity.  Aroma is a little malty very slight pine.  Taste is plain even a bit watery a bitter finish saves this beer.  Body is thin and unbalanced. Just ok

On tap.
Clear amber color with a thin head. Very strong hoppy aroma with some notes of pine and resin. Medium bodied, fairly bitter but not overwhelming, very smooth. Nice long finish with a lingering hop aftertaste. Very solid amber ale.

Bottle.  Pours clear amber with an average, fizzy beige head, medium-low retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (cookie, caramel, biscuit), heavy hops (floral, citrus), and average esters (dried fruit) with notes of peaches.  Flavor is heavy malt (cookie, caramel, biscuit), average hops (floral, citrus), and average esters (dried fruit) with notes of peaches.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation, light creaminess with a dry finish.
12oz.  Crisp clear brown ale. Sweet but w/ plenty of hops to keep it lively.  A hop fans amber.
Bottle to pilsner glass.  Dark amber, almost brown in color.  Sparse head, and decent lacing.  Nice hop flavors, but counterbalanced by a nice sweet maltyness.  Good mouthfeel.  Another winner.

From a 12 oz bottle into a Troegs pint glass.  Pours a hazy brown... kind plain brown, but whatever.  One inch of head, max and a fair amount of lacing.  Aroma is of malt and some flowers.  Mouthfeel is moderate thickness with just the right amount of carbonation....spot on!  Flavor is some real nice floral hops.  Not much bitterness at all but the hops are the full on stars here.  A good amount of brown sugar malt supports the hops.  A great beer thats either a good special beer or a good session beer; quite versatile!

12oz bottle thanks to Marcus.
Appearance : Clear amber with a medium creamy head. Some lacing.

Aroma : Nose bready malt and crisp citrusy and leafy hops. Light fruits.

Taste : Quite malty with nice citrusy and piny hops. Rather bitter on the finish with lots of malt. Light fruits on the finish. Light caramel and light sugar.

Overall : Very nice amber ale. Great malt with nice hops. Crisp and fresh while having a solid malt backbone. Very tasty stuff. Very drinkable. A great example of session beer. Great nose !

another 12oz bottle, dark amber color and the aroma was heavensent. the smell of hops was very good and the beer itsel fwas quite smooth. dont know the ibus on this one but this is one i would try again. the color and flavor really doesnt match but who cares when it taste this good.
UPDATED: SEP 17, 2011 Firkin at hop angel.  Super sweet aroma of pine, Amarillo hops.  Pine, sweet citrus, mild bitter bite.
Tap at the Crocodile lounge - nutty, caramel amber ale with a shit ton of hops. Sort of started getting sticky on my tongue. Decent, but I think it deserves a re-rate.

Cask at Sweet Afton. Effervescent red pour with puffy white head. Aroma is a modest blend of grains and perfume. Flavor has more to it. The perfume stands out with a nice background of caramel and yeast. Floral hop bite in the finish balanced with caramel malt. Excellent amber ale.

Bottle from Half Time. Pours dark ruddy amber with a 3 finger foamy beige head. Aroma is light floral and resin over lightly roasted malt. Medium body with frothy carbonation. Flavor is nicely hoppy with residual roast malt. Seems a bit peppery. Finishes hoppy, though not aggressively bitter. A lot more bitter than otherwise though.

Pours a medium and lucid amber color, nose is moderately hoppy, mildly spicy, with sweet caramels, taste is well balanced, not as sweet as most ambers, good level of bitterness, and a hop profile that really lends itself well to the style.
Pours deep red with nice lacing white head. Pine hops with a touch of caramel in the aroma.  Taste is pine hops, some caramel, touch of metallic taste, and a slighty bitter finish.
12oz bottle. nice flowery hop aroma, little bit of caramel. Balanced taste, smooth caramel malt at first taste with a bit of hop bitterness in the finish. Easy drinking.

A nice alternative to the IPA for a thirst quencher. Pours a very nice dark copper colour, with a fluffly head. Moderate aroma primarily of hops. Fresh moderately strong hoppy taste, good balance, not too bitter but with a long finish for the style. Quite nice, one to go back to over and over again because its easy to drink and enjoyable.
A regular choice, very classic taste thats a perfect example of the style.

A good looking clear hoppy amber brew with good carbonation. Aroma is light spice and malts. flavor is well balanced spicy hops and sweet malts. Not highy sticky. Finish is somewhat sweet but balanced. I would prefer a little more malts, but otherwise this is a solid brew.

Amber-brown with small white head, some lacing. Aroma is spicy, floral hops and caramel. Flavor is fresh and hoppy, kept balanced by smooth caramel. Sweet yet hoppy finish. Medium bodied, with medium-low carbonation.

Draft: Faint but nice rosehip and honey aroma. Clear ruby copper, thin head, some lacing. Rosehip, orange peel, and cinnamon flavor, a veritable potpourri. Dried leaf finish. How about that? An amber ale with hop flavor. Not very malty, some earthy notes, but the hops rule the day in this amber. Nice!

351 mL bottle.  Dont know why I havent rated this one yet.  Its one of my faves, and my ideal for an American amber.  Lovely  balance of malt and hops in aroma and flavour, sweet & spicy malt complexity, and lingering bitter finish.  Great beer.
This is a smooth mild hoppy beer. Had in growler from neighbors  kegerator.

Amber with a creamy, lightly tan head.  Fruity and floral aroma with light citrus, too.  Medium bodied.  Flavor has some fruits, sweet malts, a touch of floral, and light citrus hops.  Clean, lightly spiced, and fresh tasting.  Very nice amber.

Pours a clear amber thin fizzy tan head.  Aroma of grapefruit, citrus hops, malts.  Similar taste, but hops were kind of thin here for my liking, not the hop finish I was expecting.  Very tasty and drinkable though

Pours an amber body with a lasting ring of tan head.  Aroma is fresh, clean hops with some caramel.  Flavor is honeyed, some biscuit, and a nice clean hop.  Finish is very nicely dry and bitter, with a lasting flavor impression.

Tried tapped from Beer on the Bay in Erie PA. Sampler glass, Copper colored with a beige head that retains pretty well and leaves some lacing behind. Smell is full of resinous hops, pine, and has some nice malt behind it too, very sweet. Bitter hops on the tongue, but leads into some resinous pine and sweet caramel malt. Medium carbonation and body. Id like a little more hops in the taste to accompany the aroma, but it is just an amber ale,  I have had lighter flavored ambers. So this was quite flavorful.
Poured a nice amber color with a slight haze to it.  Very crisp taste.  Strong hops- too strong for my tastes- but still drinkable.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2010 Bottle from RegSpeir pours clear amber with a small light tan head.  sweet, citrus, earthy hop aroma backed with some nutty, toasty and bread malt aromas.  flavor is big earthy, pine hops and nutty malts.  starts sweet and finishes slightly bitter.  medium mouthfeel and low to medium carbonation.  interesting amber.  I liked it.

Poured a light copper with some two fingers of slightly off white head. Aroma is not particularly strong though some sweet caramel comes through, with just a hint of citrusy hops. Up front, the taste has a rather decent aromatic hop flavor, with some citrus and spice coming through though its not particularly strong. On the aftertaste the sweet malts balance the hops out pretty well. Body is medium. A very well rounded out amber.

pours  a clear, coppery brown with a moderate , off-white head.  Head retention is also moderate.  On the the nose, this beer has little to no hop aroma but what there is appears to be of resiny american hops.  Plenty of malt sweetness in the nose that probably overshadows the hops.  A medium bodied beer that is well carbonated.  The beer has moderate malt sweetness that is balanced with more hop flavor and bitterness than was in the nose.  This definitely a good American Amber Ale that I will be drinking again.

Poured a clear amber brown with a minimal head but good lacing throughout.  Sweet malt and hop aromas with mild citrus dominate ... not what I expected from an amber.  Body was medium to light with good malt backbone, lingering hop flavors and a lasting sweet finish.  An excellent amber!!

Pours cloudy light amber. Nice white lasting head. Aroma is hoppy, some citrus, sweet malts. Taste is hoppy, some spice, balanced by some sweet malts. Palate is crisp, good carbonation, nice medium body. Finish is dominated by hops with some light malts to help balance the taste. A well balnced Amber Ale. Very nice

Bottle pours copper-amber with a rocky khaki head. Aroma is sweet juicy berries, light citrus, and some pine.  Flavor shows the same with some caramel, and cookie backbone.  Overall body is light to moderate, light to moderate sweetness, and light bitterness.  Nice sessionable amber that doesnt make you think too hard.

Gift from an east coast friend- poured into pint glass. Mild aroma of caramel and hop. The color is fantastic--a really red-amber but darker, Id like a guitar in this color! The taste is similar to Anderson Valley Boont Amber, but with a touch more bitterness. This could be a good bridge beer for folks who like ambers and are learning and experimenting with slightly hoppier beer.

Pours a pleasant copper/amber color with some white foamy head that lingers around the edges with a faint bubbly swirl in the middle.

Very nice notes of hoppy pine on the nose.  Flavor is slightly bitter, but not overwhelmingly so.  Feels a bit on the  light side body-wise with just a little stikcyness as you drink.

All in all a good beer and one that I would drink again.

Hopback Amber Ale pours a bright amber color with about an inch of head that lingers.  The aroma is a bit metallic and floral with an earthiness underneath.  As you drink this beer, it is slightly bitter and that stays with you for a moment.  Its medium bodied and goes down easy.  This Tröegs is a great and easy beer to drink and the evident hops is Tröegs trademark.

One of seven or so Troegs from Andersons in Toledo.  Didnt know much about the brewery going in - but have liked everything theyve done so far.  Rating from 12oz bottle - deep amber brown pour with a thin light tan head.  Aroma is sweet mix of honey, pine hops and bread.  Dry malty taste with caramel, lemon and some spice.  A light acidity throughout.  Light palate with lively carbonation.  Overall comes off a little tea like - which is a good thing for me.

TROEGS IS QUICKLY BECOMING ONE OF MY FAVORITE BREWERIES  IVE HAD SEVERAL OF OF THEIR BEERS AND HAVE YET TO BE DISSAPOINTED. THIS ONE CHERRY RED COLORED BEER WITH A HOPPY FLORAL AROMA THAT HAS A HINT OF CARAMEL AND LICORICE TO IT. FULL OF ROBUST BITTER HOPS AND A HINT OF SEMI SWEET CHOCOLATE CARAMEL CANDIES, THIS IS REALLY A NICE EASY DRINKING FULL FLAVORED BREW. AND ANOTHER GEM FROM TROEGS.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2010 $8 sixer - Very fresh and smooth!  Silky palate.  Not overwhelming hoppiness--like HopBacks big brother Nugget Nectar--but extremely enjoyable and would be perfect for a summer session.  Im rating high for this one.

12 oz bottle from 3 Sons. Pours a clear amber with small off-white head. Bright citrus hop aroma backed by a little cereal malt. Predominantly hop-focused flavor, but balanced well by caramel malt. A shortly lingering bitterness. This could be a great session beer - I could drink this all day.

12oz bottle.Pours a deep amber color with a big off-white head. Aroma is very spicy, with pine and wood aromas in it. Taste is malty with grassy notes. Not impressive finish. Thick bodied. Loved the aroma.

Bottle.  A dark orange coppery pour with a medium foamy eggshell-colored head that leaves some tan lacing.  Aroma is floral and pine hops with some caramel.  Slightly bitter pine flavor with some sweet malty undertones.  Smooth, medium body.  Good.

Draught at George Keeleys. Dark amber with lacy off white head. Aroma is floral citrus hoppy with light locker room/old socks in background. Taste is floral hoppy with hint of Christmas/winter flavors. Hops grow stronger as beer warms. Good flavor for medium bodied brew. Big bitter finish that ends abruptly.
Golden pour. Very hoppy, but not overly bitter amber. Smooth and delicious. Rated 3/13/04

Served from a 12 oz bottle via RateBrackets payout box from Birdiebeagle. The appearance is a clear amber that has just a touch of haze and a small white head. The aromas are sweet with floral hop aromas that are very appealing. The flavors follow through with those sweet floral hop tones with nice citrus touches and a solid amount of caramel. Some spicier notes build through the sips. The mouth is what you would want, a nice amount of carbonation with a medium bitter burn. A great very drinkable brew.
Poured into a glass from a bottle, this poured redish amber with a very thin white head.  The smell is very hoppy.  The taste is of hops, caramel with a hint of spice.  Good beer.

Nice dark amber pour with a cream colored head. Has a very nice hop aroma for an amber. Well balanced flavor of creamy sweet malt and a little kick from the hops. Excellent amber ale, proof that amber ales dont have to be bland and boring.
Aroma is caramel, flowers. . The appearance is deep amber off white head. The flavor is caramel, floral hops. The finish is floral hops. The beer is medium in body. Simple and elegant. .

12 oz bottle courtesy of steelersfan. Thanks. Pours a translucent copper color with a medium white head that has fair retention. The aroma has oranges, and caramel malts. The flavor is very smooth with citrus hops, caramel, biscuit and pecans. The palate is full and smooth with soft carbonation. The finish is medium in duration and dry. Overall: A very sessionable and enjoyable amber ale, one of the best that Ive tried in a long time.

This is a beautiful looking beer. Amber, almost brown, slightly hazy, with an incredible tan head which hangs around for a long while. This is exactly what an ale should look like. Definite citrus hop and sweet malt aromas. The taste is very smooth with some citrus hop bitterness and a nice malty finish.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2011 Amber with a white head.  Hoppy nose of a lighter IPA.  Moderate body and hop (stronger than the aroma hins at), very drinkable with a slight earthy finish.  The segway from amber to IPA.

Notes: Also had this on cask which adds a nice smotheness

My Bottom Line:
Floral, spicy and citrusy hops proliferate atop and within biscuity cereals, leading this impressive Amber Ale to a balanced wooden hop bitterness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam slowly disappears into the clear amber.
-Now this is an attractive nose for what is usually a mailed-in style. Bravo!
-Light caramelization accompanies the biscuity character, but doesnt really bother.
-The mouthfeel is lean and quenching.
-The chosen hops and grain bill are really harmonious, which I find is not often the case in this often neglected, brew-by-numbers Amber Ales.

Bottle.

Very nice amber pour.  Balanced; not heavy on the hop aroma or flavor.  Probably unfair to review this one after Alpha King.  Nice caramel malt.  Slightly hoppy finish.  I liked it and will seek it out again though...

This is pretty much what a nice English style amber ale should be. The pour was a translucent  amber with a quick to fade white head. The aroma was a lime citrus hop with some caramel behind it. Very light on the taste with some subtle caramel and bitterness. Easy going beer which should be appealing for most.

A- Translucent amber colored body with thick white head that quickly dwindles to 1/2 a finger. Decent head retention and some lacing left behind in the glass.

S- Bitter hops hit the nose first followed by a sweet caramel malt. The bitter hops smell is big and masks the caramel malt.

T- Initial taste of strong citrus hops and grapefruit with a solid malt backbone. The finish reverses. The sweet caramel malt comes foreward for the finish with mildly bitter hops in the background. Sweet caramel malt lingers with hints of hops. Very well done and well balanced.

M- high carbonation and medium weight body. Carbonation accents grapefruit and aggressive hops at first then rounds out for a smooth and wonderful finish.

D- Im not usually a big fan of amber ales. I had this one because it was in the Troegs multi-pack I bought. This is very drinkable and my favorite amber ale yet. I was pleasantly surprised by this one. Another great brew by Troegs that I will have again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-04-2007 04:53:09

Had on draft, pours a deep copper with quickly dissipating off white head.  Aroma is caramel, earthyness and pines.  Taste is sweet then bitter with a clean finish.  The pine comes through softly and you even get a hint of roasted malts.   Light mouthfeel.

Pours a beautiful deep ruby amber with a thin white head.  Aroma is citrus hops, big and full with some nice caramel/toffee notes underneath.  Flavor is Similar.  Big citrus up front with some nice balanced sweetness in the backbone.  Really nicely balanced not terribly bitter beer.  Good one.
Pours a golden amber color with medium head.  Strong floral outdoorsy  aroma.  Very crisp clean taste.  Hoppy but not bitter.  Thoroughly enjoyed this one.  Will be a regular in my rotation.

Sixth barrel on tap.  One of my favorite Amber Ales.  Very nice hop flavor and finish with a nice floral aroma.  However, the hops are also nicely balanced by the caramel malt character of the brew and the malts dont take over the finish as they do in other ambers Ive tried.  Im a fan of MANY independent brews, but I keep HopBack around all the time!

12oz. brown bottle.

One of the prettiest looking pours i have seen.
A deep red color and a gorgeous thick and creamy head that is very lacey.

Has a hoppy floral smell to it.

Not overwhelming hoppy as far as taste. It is very very smooth drinking with a slight caramel flavor to it and very subtle spiceyness.

This is a very tasty and very drinkable brew.

This is my first sample of anything from Troegs but i really like the mouthfeel and flavor and the way it finishes.
90/100
If you like hoppy flavored beer (which i dont) you will love this beer and this brewery.  For me the hops was to much, didnt enjoy it at all.

Bottle. Great beer. Really pushes the hop barrier on the Amber Ale categorization. Quite hoppy aroma, floral. Flavor is a bit more balanced. Some nice, sweet, caramel malt character along with substantial hop presence. Medium in body. Crisp, hoppy finish. Tasty stuff.

Sampled at Central New York Brewfest, Syracuse NY. 06FE10.
App.:  Clear amber with white rim.
  
Aroma:  Some nice C-hops, lots of earthy, nutty, British malts, theres a weird note of shit (honestly).

Palate:  Medium body, moderate effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Better than the nose with very juicy grapefruit hops, pine, some decent malts, good on the whole; off-dry with decent bitterness and a hoppy finish.

Mouth trumps nose (phew!).
Strong hoppy aroma, very clean finish that differentiates this from many stong hop beers .  Nice amber to orange, deep color. Satisfying beer
Color is a beautiful, rich, orangy amber. Nice bitter aftertaste. Aftertaste is better than taste, though. Aroma is a bit weak.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2010 Bottle poured into a pilsner glass produced a dark amber body with smooth, creamy, off-white head.  Aroma of earthy malts and fruits.  Flavor of pine, spruce, light fruits, and slightly sweet ginger with a touch of hop bitterness in the finish.  A perfectly balanced ale and one of Troegs best.

Bottle at the de-boned chicken tasting. Pours a clear amber with an off-white head. Hoppy with aromas of malts. Hopsprofile is floral with some resin notes. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Not-so-fresh bottle?
Amber pour with a nice hoppy taste with a noticeably bitter finish. An overall balanced mix of sweet and bitter.

12oz bottle from ChyldKing. Pours a clear copper color with a small white head. Nose is hoppy up front with some light resiny notes and a solid malt backbone that is doughy. Palate is smooth and full, with a nice bitterness in the finish. Flavors of the resiny hop notes and a solid malty, doughy background that balances very well making this extremely drinkable.

Nice amber pour, nose of caramel and pine resin-- fresh hops. Sweetness and body as you would expect greater than an IPA but well balanced by hops and carbonation. None of the cloying syrupy quality of many brown/amber ales. Goes down deceptively easily for a 6% beer.
Bottle thanks to bman1113vr. Clear brown pour with a yellow foamy head. Aroma is sweet malt, slight hop pine bitterness on the back end. Flavor is bitter, slight pine, pretzels and dust.

Bottle thanks to beerbill. Pours with a clear amber body and an off-white ring. Aroma is hoppy with caramel, and light tea notes. Taste is caramel, hoppy and pine. Creamy carbonation and light bubbles.

Pours a beautiful amber color with medium head. Nose has citrus, hops and earthy notes. Soft mouthfeel and slightly bitter finish. The hops are not overbearing and you get a lot of the citrus and earth in the flavor. Great beer for any season!
Bottle. Sweet hops and malty nose. Poured a rich amber. There is some sweetness to this. Decent balance with a bunch of malt backbone. Flavor overall seems a bit off. Too sweet for my taste.

Pours a golden amber color with nice transparency.  The first sip hits you with the crisp hopiness that i crave.  But yet it still maintains a refreshing quality that leaves you wanting another.  One of my favorites for sure, glad to live so close to the brewery!

Pours amber with a slight off-white head. The aroma is piney hops with some malt. The flavor is more of the same with piney hops and a nice caramel malt backbone. Medium-thin mouthfeel and low carbonation. Not the most complex beer in the world but a very good drinker.

Poured from a growler straight from Troegs Brewery. A amber color with a nice medium head. The smell of hops and caramel, Hit the nose. The taste is almost like an IPA but dialed down, It has sticky, feel with average carbonation, with what i thought was a  long finish.

Bottle, thanks to kepersj12. Lovely looking label. Poued an appealing amber colour with a slight haze and a smallish off-white head. Aroma was suitably fragrant hop with some good fruit in evidence too. Very well balanced caramel malt flavour and a winning hop profile that is nicely restrained.  All considered a pretty darn tasty brew.

Hand pump at Standard Tap in Philadelphia. Very flowery hoppy aroma, citrusy. Fairly balanced sweetness with a medium body, lots of grapefruit hop (cascade?) flavors. This being on cask, it had that full, yet slippery texture.

12 oz bottle. Pours amber color with a foamy, long lasting head. Aroma of citrus hops and some malt in the background. Medium crisp body. Citrus hops dominate the flavor with caramel malt provide nice balance at the later stage. 
Finish is long and bitter. This beer could be nice IPA as well.

Bottle from Secret Santa. Pours cloudy amber color with khaki head. Sweet malty aroma. Moderately sweet flavors of caramel and molasses with slight hop bitterness.  Medium body with average carbonation. A nice amber ale.
Bottle. Pours an amber body with an off white head.   Fresh pine, and bitter earth tones, some light floral tones, and slick caramel.  Bittering slightly dry finish. A well hopped amber.  Nice.

A nice version of a hoppy amber ale and a local that has waited too long for me to try it.  This beer comes out with a nice piney hop aroma that fades into citrus hop flavor as you drink.  The beer has a nice balance of malt and hop flavor without being overly bitter.
Very malty taste, some caramel sweetness in there as well, nice little hop kick as well.  Goes down real smooth, highly sessionable.

aroma is excellent balance of citric hop notes and hefty caramel backup.  appearance is tarnished amber, yet translucent. flavor is chewy caramel with hop backup, an equal balance in opposite terms via the aroma.  well balanced amber that still qualifies despite strong hopping.
Bottle: Reddish amber pour with off-white head. Lots of maltiness backed up with hops, some fruitiness. Overall good session beer.
Tap. Dark amber with white head. Aroma is earthy with caramel, biscuit and spice. Flavors of caramel, apple and spice. A subtle bitterness. Medium body with inviting palate.
12 oz Bottle -- Pours reddish-amber with an off-white head.  Lots of sweet malt on the nose with some floral hops in the background.  Big malty character providing caramel and dried fruits.

12oz. Pours a clear amber with a thin, white head that has some okay retention and no lacing. Aroma is caramel, floral hops. Taste is nice caramel malt, some lemon, dry hops, a bit earthy, toast, biscuit. Not bad. Nice bittering hops throughout.

Nice copper pour.  Potent hoops and marzipan come off to smell as well as some light spice notes.  Body is well rounded and full mouth coating flavor.  Nice piney floral hops presence as well as a balancing sweet almost fruity caramel touch.  Bold flavor for the style and a solid brew for sure.
This is an excellent "hoppy" beer full of flavor and aroma and a very full bodied taste this beer is a very good find, that is if you can find it!!

UPDATED: APR 27, 2011 Bottle and Draft. 12 and 16 oz, respectively. Pours chesnut brown with a moderate, fluffy off-white head. Aroma of fresh dry hops, musty, sweet malt, slight savory and nuttiness, and traces of pine, honey, and hay. Medium to full bodied with a charming, rich, amazingly lively mouthfeel. Nice sharp finish, but smooth as well. Very good amber ale.

The Hops are booming on this ale. You can smell them, you can taste them.
Not overdone, as some micros do these "hoppy ales".
Clear red/amber. Sorry - this is not my favorite category or i might have rated this higher.

Bottle at Sunes - Thanks Mr. Johnson & Mr. Nielsen. Clear red/amber - white head. Caramel, nice hoppy, fruity, resin, toasted, knækbrød (swedish flatdread), dusty, high malty, pine needles. Pleasant.
Found this one bottled as part of a multi-pack in Cherry Hill, Ney Jersey.  Very potent piney and rosey hoppiness, spicy, tounge-tingly alcoholic, strong finish.

Clear amber pour with medium carbonation and a half finger off white head. Aroma is toasty malt with some citrus, some grain, and caramel. Some slight flowery notes come in near the end of the sniff. Flavor is caramel malt with a balancing nondescript hop bitterness that provides nice balance. Palate is medium bodied with medium carbonation and a clean smacking finish. Very well put together.

Certainly an amber pour with an off white, bubbly head. Aroma holds toasty malt, caramel, grain, and some citrus and floral hop character. Flavor is sweet, with more caramel malt, and some sweet spices, perhaps nutmeg. Hop character is present but very subtle, with a bit of fresh floral presence. Palate is a bit thin, but certainly drinkable. Good session beer; just not a great style, but clearly a well crafted beer.

Nice golden-amber color. Interesting nose. Lemony. Zesty. Clean and sharp. Nearly tasteless. Low malt profile, bit of hops, just a point. Nothing else. Disappointing. Lighly bodied.
Bottle.  Floral aroma, deep amber color, minimal head. Medium flavor, medium body, creamy texture and fizzy carbonation with a long finish.  Enjoyed, a bit hoppy with a long, hoppy finish.

On tap at Fat Bobs in Buffalo.  Amber pour, very hoppy for an amber.  Citrusy smell, but slightly deeper than an IPA in terms of flavor.  Piney scent and taste too.  This was a lot more hoppier than was expecting although I should have realized it, given the Hopback name.

Poured a deep red amber with a good head and medium lacing. Smelled of hops and citrus. Tasted of hops, citrus with a caramel sweetness to temper the bitterness of the hops. Finishes with a bitter yet sweet taste that leaves the mouth a little dry. Enjoyable.

[2521-20091009] 12floz bottle. Grass clippings and bread hops aroma with some fresh citrus rind. Clear, dark orange amber body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Rich grainy metallic grassy hops flavour. Full body is bitter. Quite tasty, good balance though hints at being old.
(From Premier Gourmet, Buffalo, NY; w/ jerc)
bottle, via trade with beachbum25, amber color with tasty malty hopped aroma, flavors of pine hops, bready malts with good balance and finish

Draft at Churchkey, but this was a cask dry-hopped with palisades hops. Light brown iced tea color. No head (probably due to the cask). Smells faintly resiny but also has some honey and sweetness. Very thin palette, piney hops and some floral/grassy notes on the back palette. Pretty good, but I wouldnt necessarily say what I experienced is indicative of all of Hopback.
Pours amber, bitterness comes through in the aroma.  Nice taste, hops is very apparent, but it has a nice balance.  A nice drinkable but flavorful beer.

12oz - A slightly sweet nose distracted me on the pour.  The amber colored liquid produced a nice, inch thick tan head.  The palate was solid, substantial flavors of wood, oily texture.  I like this the best of the Troegs Ive tried to date.

2009-10-09. Dark amber body, small foamy beige head fades. Mild aroma of green leafy hops, touch of caramel malt. Flavour is lightly bitter, mild green leafy hops over smooth but modest sweet caramel malt, light toasty touches to the malt. Average plus palate is lightly carbonated. Decent, pleasantly quaffable but a touch muted overall. I suspect it has a bit more zip closer to the bottling date, but there is no best before on the bottle. Bottle from Premier Gourmet

2009 Bottle - Thanks dand645! - Pours a translucent amber with a ring of off white...aroma is caramel malt, floral hops, sweet dough...flavour is fairly tasty, bitter and grainy, with a sweet finish...bits of lemon zest and unappealing oily sour hops...good flavour out of this one with the one exception...I could drink a few of these...
good amount of hops in both the nose and flavor, nothing really special, but a decent little beer with not too much going on
Pours a nice copper color.  Aroma is of hops...good and promising.  Taste is a bit tart, thin and not that enjoyable.  One very bland but above average ambers.

Rich, complex hop aroma, good carbonation, and ample hop lace promise a hop bomb.  The flavor delivers deep, lasting hop presence, balanced between citrus and earthy bitterness, and finishes long with its dry hopping.  The caramel malt does not quite offset the massive hop infusion, but the blend of hops can be admired on its own.

12 oz bottle courtesy of an extra from msante79. Thanks, Mark! Pours a pretty dark hazy amber, a decent tannish head on top that dies to a film, laces some. Aromas are a decent aromatic hoppiness, citrus and florals, a bit muted, with some underlying caramel malts. Lemon rind and grapefruit, the malt is tamer than anticipated. Initial is lighter, a bit watery with some decent lemon citrusy hop and a light caramel maltiness, vaguely toasty, a watery type body. Backend moves to a bit of blandness, lightly hoppy bitter and sweet and toasy malt on the backend. Ok, finish is a bit bland but certainly quaffable. Ok overall.
bottle..amber pour.. thin beige head ,minimum lacing.aroma of fresh hops.caramel malt sweetness with an excellent hop bitterness,very good hop flavor .a touch thin,but highly drinkable.
Amber color with a small off white head. Aroma of piney hops and some sweet malts. Flavor of caramel malts and piney hops. Very drinkable.
Amber pour with an offwhite head.  Citrus hops domiante the aroma with some sweet malt in the background.  Flavor is bursting with piney hops and sweet caramelly malts.  REally nice

Bottle. Thanks JB. Medium amber color with a thin, lacy head. Big citrus hop aroma with caramel and sweet amber malt. Nice malt flavor: slightly earthy, with rich caramel and swee malt, piney hops, and a strongly bitter finish. Big flavored amber with good hopping. I like it.

Serving: Draft from a firkin.
Appearance: Pours a hazy, dirty brown with a small, creamy, light tan head.  Great head retention and lacing.
Aroma: Decent pine hop nose, light floral notes, and some caramel malt aromas.  Not as forthcoming as I was expecting from Troegs.
Taste: Very hop forward with strong floral and soap notes.  Light pine notes lurk there as well.  From the malt side I get light biscuit notes.  Okay, but a little on the soapy side for my liking.
Palate: Low carbonation (to be expected from a firkin) with a medium, slightly dry mouthfeel.  Medium, bitter finish.
Overall: The dryness gives it an almost airy mouthfeel.  This one is decent and sessionable, but I would like to try it on tap as well.
Rebuy: Yes, but I want to try the regular draft and bottled versions.

Draft.  Pours reddish amber with medium off-white head.  Hoppy aroma with some fruit, floral notes, and sweet malt.  Flavor is more of the same, and very well balanced.  Light body, bitter but not overwhelmingly so, and finishes with a crisp, clean bite.
This is a great beer.  Perfectly balanced with a nice finish.  I cant wait to pick more of this up on my next beer run.
12oz bottle. Apple red color with a lacy white head. Aroma is nicely hoppy and fruity. Flavors are well blended and quite delicious. Fruity, floral, just enough bitterness.

Draft:  Burnt amber, thin off-white head.  Malty flavors with a hint of crisp hoppiness.  Somewhat fruity flavors with stale dried pineapple and maybe a hint of apple. The maltiness overpowers the hops here as an amber ale should, but amber ales are soooo great.  woo hoo.

On tap at Bier Markt in Cleveland into pint glass.  Nice dark amber color with a pretty decent off-white head.  Floral and bitter hops on the nose with a bit of matly sweet background.  Great bite working with juicy hops and bitterness.  Went great with the mussels I was eating.

Tröegs HopBack Amber Ale is a very clear, solid amber ale with a thick, dense, yellowish head that has outstanding retention and lacing.  It has a fresh hoppy aroma, citrusy and grassy with a hint of sweetness.  Its medium bodied, foamy and very smooth.  The finish is clean and dry.  This is beautifully balanced.  That touch of sweetness seems to go with both the juicy hops and the caramel malt.  Theres a little bit of roastiness in the after taste.  This is an ideal beer!

Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a pint glass.

The color is a deep red with a gold tint. The head is two fingers and is a slightly foamy white.

The smell is a bit fruity with a little floral hints. A light caramel and some good hop flavor as well

The taste has a light bitterness, malty with a nice hop finish.

This beer is a great drinkable beer. Is well balanced and goes down easy.
UPDATED: DEC 13, 2009 Poured a dark amber.  Hops hit first with their delicious grapefruit flavor. Then a nice caramel backbone. Good full-flavoured beer. This is a great session beer.

Bottle courtesy of birdiebeagle.  Pours a clear amber color.  Moderate white head with excellent retention and lacing.  Aroma is floral hops and caramel malt.  In the flavor, the floral hops hit you up front but it smooths out into toasted grains and sweet caramel.  Mouthfeel is a little on the sticky side, but not distractingly so.  I would classify this as a hybrid amber/IPA.  It works.
Clean ale aroma with a beautiful clear copper color. The flavor has an elastic quality to its hops which starts and ends with the same intensity. The hops arent too bitter, just right.

The head on this beer is thick and fluffy. Ruby red with a brown tinge. Glassy but with a haze on the glass. Quite a nice body. The smell is an awesome combo of dark caramel and bitter, woddy hops. The hops evolve into citrus. Really outstanding. The dark roasted caramel gives a needed balance. The flavor is a toasted, roasted caramel malt but with more bitterness at the latter stages. Its bold on both fronts, the hops and malt. These two strong flavors need each other to keep the seesaw a-movin. The feel is thick and chewy, creamy and viscous. Really good. Its a bold and challenging drink. Smooth, dark and bitter. Quite nice.

Very filtered looking.  Dark orange, some head.  Pure hops nose.  Smell like hops but I guess on the piney side of citrus.  Decent mouthfeel, silky, somewhat try, decent balance between the malt and hops.  Not sure about the high average rating.  This is a decent honest beer but not a lot special going on here.

12 oz draft served in a clear pint glass.  Nose is citrus, caramel, and florally hops.  Taste is very much the same.  I was pleasantly surprised by this brew.  Enough malt to balance the hop, and a good bit borrowed from some of the best IPAs.  A very tasty step towards developing a taste for hops.
very nice amber with loads of hops and caramel malts. I was pleasantly surprised by this one...it is what it is...
Tap. For the base of nugget nectar this is what you would expect. A good pick if your looking to drink a bunch on a warm sunny day.

From 12 oz bottle.  Taste of malt and hops.  Taste of caramel.  The bottle indicates that there is spice in here, if so it was not very prevalent.  A pretty good beer, but in my opinion it is a bit overrated.
From bottle, pours with great clarity and warm amber color. Comes with a range of malt and hop flavors, medium-lean body (profile reminds me of a light Red Rocket) and steady finish.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2010 Super Saver in Somerville nj, 6 pack with the bottled on date one week ago, wow thats fresh...best amber ive tasted.. nicely hopped, this taste great, could now be my weekend beer when i what to throw a bunch back without gettin to lit...great beer

Bottle in Virginia.  Pours a deep caramel with a nice whitish head that leaves a thin sticky lacing.  Aroma is a nice complex hop profile with caramel and rye.  The flavor is similar.  A delightful aftertaste of floral hops remains well after the glass was empty.

On cask at Zenos. Medium orange hue with modest white sustaining head for a cask.  Nose is floral and earthy-tealike hops, some sweet caramel. Flavor is lavendar flowers and tea leaves, lighter caramel and bready malts, low bitterness. Smooth creamy texture, medium body.  A sweet and balanced hoppy amber cask, good drinkability.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2009 On tap at RnH (NYC). Easy on the eyes with a rich amber-wood pour, this ones loaded with eclectic flowery hops with some bitter citrus tastes hidden in there. Sweet caramel balances any spicy clove notes. Overwhelmingly delicious. #037 on 30062009, DG.

bottle at the deli in state college thanks to troeg brewery.  pours a golden color with a white head.  The smell is sweet and citrus hops.  the taste is very smooth and sweet with a hop back nicely balanced like they always do.

Pours a nice amber with off white head leaves some lacing on the glass nice sweet aroma sweet malts caramel and a nice balanced transition to the hop a more complete beer than other troegs the hop is toned down and slightly spicey a very sessionable brew
Medium copper pour with a light head and good carbonation.  Resin and pine in the aroma.  Bitterness matches but does not overwhelm.  Medium caramel and sugar body.  Nicely balances.

Pours a clear copper with a small white head. Aroma is sticky and sweet - caramel and citrus hops. Taste is the same plus a nice earthiness. Smooth mouth feel with moderate carbonation. Drinkable and enjoyable.

Sample at the Troegs and Dark Horse tasting at Blacklick Wine and Spirits on 6/5/09.  Clear amber pour with a medium tan head.  Citrus hop aroma with some malt thrown in.  Earthy and citrusy hop flavor with a nice malt balance.  I actually prefer this to the Nugget Nectar.

Amber hue with tan creamy head, decent lacing, sweet smell, not much spice and very faint hop, carmel aftertaste, nice balance, relatively light body but that seems to be Troegs characteristic, but this is refreshing one.
pours a clear copper with an offwhite head.  nice floral hop aroma.  very smooth and refreshing.  not too bad.

12 oz bottle.  Not sure on the freshness of this one, but there was way less hop bite than I expected.  A bit of caramel came through, and although taste was pleasant, it wasnt very strong.  Not bad, but as others have said, kind of neutral.

Enjoyed from a 12oz bottle in a mini pilsner glass.  The beer pours a solid copper color, with a white head.  Aromas of American hops are prevalent in the nose.  Given the fact that it was an American Amber Ale, I was expecting some sort of combination of citrusy hops and caramel malt; and was reinforced in this expectation after reading the commerical description.  While the hops were right there on the palate, providing smooth bitterness and a nice flavor, I found the malt portion of the palate to be essentiallky non-existent.  At best, there was a slight touch of caramel; but less of a note than one would expect in this style.  Overall, a nice beer that is good for 80 degree days, but one that is just a bit of crystal malt short of being great.

I get barely any discernible aroma, just a little bit of caramel.  Very clear tawny, pretty light color.   Maybe I got an old bottle.  Tastes fine, but light and a touch of caramel and leather in the finish.  Not many hops, finishes clean and absent of any real flavor.  Im not saying its bad, its just very neutral and inoffensive on all sides.

Nice medium amber color with a big off white head.  Nice looking pour.  Nice hoppy nose.  Big notes of pine with some decent citrus mixed in.  Creamy  mouthfeel with a nice touch of caramel sweetness before finishing with that big hoppy bitterness.  Good beer.

This was an extra in a rescent trade. I ve had nugget nectar many times befoe and I have passed this one up on my travels. I finally tried this beer and boy I was missing out. Very great nose thats citrusy and piney, but really well balanced. a very refreshing beer for the summer months ahead.
Nice floral hops aroma, and a good grapefruit/citrus taste to it. A well balanced Amber and another solid beer from Troegs. LC

Bottle. Moderate malt aroma of roasted, light orange and dough for the hops and yeast, with toffee and dried fruit in the background. Head is small, creamy with some larger bubbles, off white, with fair lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is clear copper. Flavor is lightly sweet and moderately acidic to start, then finishes lightly acidic and light to moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery and has a lively carbonation. A little bit of complexity and an easy drinking quality makes this a pretty good Amber.
I had it, but was drunk. Re-rate coming later. Rabble rabble rabble rabble rabble.

Pours orange-amber in color with a white head. Real hoppy aroma, kind of spicy. Hoppy, dry taste with a decent malt backbone. Some caramel on the tongue, but hard to find with the strong hops. All the hops left a very dry finish.

On tap and bottles. On tap, nice and cold and crisp. Amber color, obviously. Small head. Aroma of caramel malts and some nice hops. Very balanced and drinkable. Taste is great, sweet, malty, hoppy, some mild spice and juicyness. Really good.

pours a cloudy orange amber with a thin head and some sudsy laseing aling the sides of the glass. The nose is nice and floral full of fresh hops and hints of caramel malt. This flavor is nice and bitter with a big hop bite in the begining and then it fades after each sip. It keeps biting your toung and there are some hints of lemon grass and spice but nothing potent. There is great carbonation and overall it is a great brew.
