Tap...  Poured amber with a thick, frothy, white head.  Aroma of hops and malted grains.  Light, fizzy palate with a moderate carbonation.  Simple flavors of hops and sweet, toasted grains.  Finish was sorta acidic with a little bit of an alpha-resinous bitterness.

12 oz. Bottle. Pours a crystal clear copper with a frothy off-white head that leaves decent lacing on the glass. Great floral, hoppy aroma with a subtle caramel malt background. Up front the flavor is a floral with a faint citrusy hop taste, balanced nicely by a sweet caramel malty character. Smooth, balanced finish. Medium bodied. Excellent Amber Ale.

Crystal clear copper color.  Moderate level head that leaves generous amount of lace.

Caramel is the dominant smell; light but floral hop in the background.  Slightly metallic.

Nice balance with a decent body.  Pleasant malt start, mostly crystal.  The swallow presents the bitter hop, but the aftertaste is brief.  This is a very easy beer to drink.
On Tap at Mellow Mushroom. Amber with little head. Aroma is hoppy with notes of spice and amber malts. Flavor is citrusy hops and slight caramel malts. Finish is dry and clean.
12oz bottle. Another good offering from Troegs. Very much an IPA as far as I am concerned though it certainly is amber in color. Great hop taste and very drinkable.

Bottle poured into a standard pint glass produced a finger worth of white head that went to a thick lace. The body of the brew was a clear red in color.

The aromas were piney hops followed by some nice malts sweetness. The flavor boils down to a less hoppy Nugget Nectar. I like it is very balanced and easy to drink. With its medium to light feel in the mouth and great carbonation. 

This brew is a good balanced brew very drinkable and easily quaffable. I will go back to this brew again

Hey...how did I miss this one?  Ive only been tripping over the case I bought for three weeks now. Ahh a nice hoppy critter a bit on the juicy side.  A deeper amber in the glass. Infused malt with a fair ammnt of tang in the finish. Four of these make a good pain killer if you try to saw your finger off.

Bottle from coldbrewky. Nice amber body with sticky head. Great hoppy nose with notes of sweet fruits. And lots of hops in the taste. No false advertising here. Slight kick in the finish. I know Ambers vary but this one felt more like an IPA. Very nicely done. Thanks again Steve!

Source:  12oz bottle from a mixed 12 pack, purchased in Washington DC.Appearance:  Clear amber color with a one finger white head.Aroma:  Floral, pine and sweet fruit.Flavor:  Sweet malt base with a pine hop finish.  A bit of citrus in the middle. Palate:  Medium body and slightly stickly mouthfeel, but overall very clean.  Carbonation was solid.  Overall:  Really enjoyed this, as I do most Troegs offerings.  Not much to complain about.
Im really enjoying the sixtel of this one.  Just enough hop flavor to balance out the malty backbone of this amber.  It wont overwhelm but it wont disappoint.  Solid choice.

Crushed with Jakebra.  Apparently better on tap, but this int bad at all.  Malt, hops, bit of poop on the nose.  Flavor has much more hops and malt, with much less poop.  Excellent amber, which I havent had the pleasure of saying very often.

Location: 12 oz bottle from Gillys, 4/7/09


Aroma: Honey, floral, fruity

Appearance: Amber color, 2 inches of white head

Flavor: Mostly sweet, nice balanced beer, pine hops release as it warms

Palate: Drinks pretty easily, smooth, creamy taste

Overall Impression: 
This is a pretty nice, interesting beer, not exactly as hoppy as you might have expected.  Kind of flatter then I expected, a nice beer though.
12 oz bottle....hops and hops... thats about it.... doesnt seem to be balanced very well, if you want hops you got it
12 ounce bottle. Very solid hops aroma. Great hoppy pine taste. I could take down  a lot of these beers. Very delicious. Would buy again soon
user_location: The World of Beer, Texas, USA

text: Poured amber with white head. Aroma of citrus and caramel. Good balance of citrus and caramel flavor. Solid session. Tasty.

From bottle. Deep amber colour with a decent frothy white head. Sweet, fruity aroma with berries and raspberry maybe. Smooth texture. Slight tangy finish. Rich flavour of honey, berries, malt and hops. Nice.

Has a nice and easy brown color.  Smells of sweet old hops.  Has a nice hoppy flavor.  Nice aftertaste in the end.  This is a smooth hop beer.  Its almost so smooth that it makes me think this is a light hop beer.  Good job though.

Bottle. Big head laces immediately. Particularly fruity nose, orange and maybe cherries, well supported by hops. Flavor though is somewhat muted at first, perhaps because it is fresh from the fridge, but it is increasing as I drink. Kind of creamy actually - not the texture I was expecting, but nice. Enjoyable. Thought it would be hoppier.
brown pour with small light brown head light molasses aroma with nutty taste and short bitter finish.

From a 12 fl. oz. bottle with a bottled date of 012209 and a number of 090107.  This pours a nice looking amber-orange with lively carbonation that rises to a two finger, foamy beige head.  The aroma is hoppy all the way, almost like an IPA.  Perhaps some background fruity element. Medium mouthfeel with good texture. The flavor is hoppy and sweet all at once and rather unique.  A bitter finish. Yum-Oh.

Pours an amber color with a thin white head.  Aroma is sweet, very fruity, hops.  Taste is slight caramel malt, orange peel, and nice mild hop flavor.  Very easy drinking brew that goes down nicely.  Nothing great about it, but very pleasant.

Pours an orangish amber, light head. Nice floral aroma. Excellent hop flavor and nice bitterness. Clean finish that leaves you wanting another one. At 6.0 they sneak up on you. This beer is a must for hopheads.

Courtesy MrChopin. Clear amber. Small off white head. Great balance of toasty malt and fresh hops combine for a spicy, fruity, and mildly sweet brew. Medium body, balanced carbonation. Easy drinking session brew with plenty of character.

Draught.   Clear amber with a sticky head.   Fresh hoppy nose in a floral, resiny, citrucy fashion.   Pretty clean caramel malt flavor with lots of juicy hop flavor.   Reminds me of nugget nectar session version, but what did I expect.   Solid amber ale.

On tap at Dilly Deli. Ruby amber with a small tan head. Aroma of citrus and sweet malts. Bold flavor of citrus hops, especially for the style, with a nice malt profile of caramel sweetness. Balanced mouthfeel. Good for a summer session.

Bottle from MrChopin.  Pours a nice medium amber color with an off white head that left great lacing.  Great nose of toasted malts, wheat, and a touch of hops.  The hops were much more developed in the flavor.  A nice toasty finish.
Tap at a Georgetown bar in DC. Decent. The hop flavor was a little stale and cheesy. Maybe dirty tap lines? The caramel seemed evident until I drank a year old Alpha King directly afterward.

Bottle 355ml  
Appearance:  dark amber with reddish hue. Medium neatly contrasting snowy cover.Nose:  Soft , light aromatic hop nose. Fruity , flowery , green organic aroma of garden after spring rain. Light amber malt hints followed. 8- Flavor/Palate : Medium bodied. Solid hop profile, fresh, clean straight properly brewed American Bitter. Enough malt at base to balance more or less. Neat hop sided session brew.

Bottle.  Deep mahagony color with a small white head.  Aroma is very malty and not as hoppy as I would have expected or liked.  I get some faint yeasty aromas as well.  Flavor is malty up front followed by a very light dose of hops.  The finish is tart and lemony. Pretty nice beer.  Should be more hoppy however.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2009 12oz bottle from grape & gourmet. pours a very nice dark copper color with hints of red and a very thin, white head and a ring of lace. aroma is nicely hoppy with floral notes and citrus scents of orange and lemon. A bit of spiciness and sweet, darker malts round out the aroma. Flavor is very solid and tilted slightly to the malty side with sweet, bready caramel malt flavors. A nice citrus and herbal hop bitterness add good balance and a dry, crisp finish. palate is very smooth, medium bodied, with slightly high carbonation. overall a very solid session amber that is great when fresh.
Troegs delivers another solid but unspectacular beer.  Nutty, earthy in both taste and aroma, a pretty golden hue of a pour.  Medium bodied and carbonated.

Pours a light amber color with a nice head. It has a strong citrusy hop aroma with a small malt smell. Taste is of malt with a strong hop bitterness, but not too strong. This beer is lowly carbonated with a medium mouthfeel. Its a good hoppy amber ale.

Finally troegs in Ma. A little disapointed with this one however. Lost my rating notebook, but it was only last night. Pours a reddish amber very thin head. My initial taste made me think of popcorn, subtle hops, and some sweet caramel like notes. Not impressed, but not disgusted so I guess a happy medium in a category that I have little rating experience in.

Bottle from mixed pack.  Pours cherry red with a milky head.  Aroma of wonderfully soapy, citrusy hops!  Grapefruit, lime, lemon, soap, and tangerine.  Flavor is soapy throughout with a soft palate.  There is also much citrus, and a touch of toastiness on the finish.  Overall, although the flavor was a bit of a letdown after the extraordinary aroma, this brew surely is one of the top ambers out there.

Thanks to my boss for bringing this to me from Pa. Very nice looking  pour from a 12 oz. bottle. Rich amber with a creamy tan head. Slow to diminish with nice lacing. Nice balance of sweet malt with a bitter hop finish. Will ask for more.

Another good, well-balanced beer from my hometown boys in the HBG.  Amber color, off-white head.  Aroma of sweet malt and floral hops.  Flavor is caramel malts and fresh-tasting east coast hops, not quite as hoppy as an IPA but more than a typical amber ale.  Medium palate and carbonation.  Good stuff.

Thanks Brigadier. Pours a clear, nearly red amber with a finger of beige head, which dissipates to a ring and some lace.  Aroma is citric hops and sweet malts.  The flavor begins much the same, oranges, brown sugar, and then becomes incredibly bready.  This is as close as you get to fresh baked bread in a glass.  The aroma elements emerge again for a very floral finish.  Only minor off element that the grain is a bit too husky for my taste.  Medium bodied, lightly prickly on the palate.
nice amber color, nose is citrus but also a little malts in the background. flavor is both, a little to much on the bittering hop, very dry finish.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2009 Pours amber/copper into a shaker.  Off-white head pancakes and recedes in larger surface bubbles.  Sweet citrus and resin aromas.  Crisp and well balanced with caramel upfront and a lasting dry grapefruit and resin finish.
Poured and amber color slightly reddish great flavour,also great hop balance.caramel malts with a smooth finish good beer

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2012 Re-rate 8/20/13: Bottle sample at a tasting at LiBira pub. Thanks zvikar. Malt, stale hops, bitterness. 6/3/6/3/12=3

(11/10/08) Bottle at friends house in Philadelphia (thanks David T). Clear deep reddish amber color with a bubbly beige head. Aroma of piney hops, resin and caramelly malt. Sweet caramelly malt at first with some toasted notes and then a bitter finish with hops and pine needles. Medium-bodied. Pretty tasty. 7/4/6/3/13=3.3

12 oz bottle. Poured a nice  golden amber, with no haze. An offwhite creamy head that lasted a fair while with good cling. Aroma is mostly citrusy hops. Flavor is a pretty balanced palate, a bit of malty up front with a nice hop kick, maybe some sweeter notes in the aftertaste. The hops are a little bitter but smooth out after a little while.

Tap.  Pours clear amber with a thin white head.  Aroma is heavy hops with slightly-detectable grain (Im wondering, based on the aroma, if this was dry-hopped).  Taste is heavy floral hop and malt balanced out very well.  This is a great beer, and Ill be trying much more from this brewery.
Smells very hoppy, strong sour scent. Taste is very nicely balanced dark malts and sour hops. Very tasty beer

amber in color with a thin white head and nice lacing.  the aroma is very floral with some pine notes.  very earthy and floral flavor with caramel malts up front and mild grapefruit followed by pine and a bit of spice in the finish which is slightly dry.  i could definitely enjoy this as a session beer...

Pours an amber color with an off-white head.  Aroma is of citrus hops, caramel malts, and some earth aromas.  Flavor is the same with a decent bitter finish from the citrus hops.  A pretty decent amber.

growler. pours red, copper with a decent off white head. hop flavor is similar to celebration (slight citrus, resinous)  the body is definitely thinner. makes it a nice session with a good profile. malt is crisp but flavorful. a solid amber.

bottle poured a caramel amber color with a coating of off white head that retained a thin layer. aroma has some citrus hops, mild caramel malt, and a touch of grass. flavor has a nice sweet citrus grapefruit thing but is light on the delivery. malt picks up in the flavor and bitterness comes through to finish with some pine. really solid session level and well enjoyed.

Mahogany-amber with thin silken head. Refreshing burst of PNW hops. notably Cascade. Hint of bubblegum. Pleasantly flavorful pop of hop flavors and crystal malts with the reappearance of bubble gum. A well-balanced, well-hoped amber that makes for a solid session candidate.

Troegs is just one of those breweries that just makes good beer.

this beer pours a really great amber color such that is suggested by the name
The balance of hops and malts in this beer makes it smooth and easy to drink. I wish we could get it out here in Chicago. The aroma is clean with a very good hop nose to it with malty undertones

I really like this beer.

12oz Bottle: Poured dark amber with a tiny biege head. Aroma is full of citrus hops with sweet malt in the background. Flavor is of piney hops with a nice malt backbone. Very well balanced, drinkable beer. Slightly bitter finish. Very smooth, nice beer to keep around...

12 oz bottle from Market of Choice, was very random to find this here in Oregon, but I was happy to give it a shot. Nice amber pour with a moderate tan head. Nice big hoppy flavor which is unusual for the style. Pretty well balanced as well, nice malt flavors. Solid offering though I was expecting a little more from what I have heard about this brewery.

12oz bottle. Pours amber with off white head. Aroma is floral hops, caramel malt and citrus. Flavor is hoppy with notes of citrus and pine with nice caramel malt backbone. Mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation. Nice hoppy amber ale.

Bottle.  Pours a rich deep dark amber color with a medium sized light tanned colored head.  The sweet smell of citrus hops meet the nose even while pouring, and upon closer inspection a light background of malt comes out.  Lovely thick creamy body with a hint of sweetness.  Very soft finish, and not nearly as much hoppy bitterness as I might like, especially given the aromas coming off the nose.

Bottle. Poured a clear copper color with a thin beige head. Nice floral hoppy aroma with some caramel hints. Flavor has a nice balance of hops and malty sweetness. Nice bitter aftertaste. A mellow watery mouthfeel. Very decent drinkable beer with nice flavor. Ambers are one of my favorite styles, but this doesn’t blow me away.

Pours to a dark orange amber with a 1.5 finger head.  Good bit of hops on the nose.
HInts of floral on the nose, but not as much citrus as expected.
On the palate this is a strong beer -- good caramel flavor with a solid overtone of  floral hops. A touch of mineral flavor also, but nothing to detrimental.  Certainly a bit toasty as well. 
Smooth hoppy finish. Hardly much  evidence of the decently high alcohol percentage.

Bottle from brentk56. Thanks! Nice darker amber pour with a thin head. The aroma is that of toasted caramel malts and some nice floral/earthy hops. A touch of wood too. Nice flavors of earthy hops upfront followed by toasted malts, light caramel sweetness and earthy woody hops in the finish. Rather dry finish. A very nice amber ale.

12oz bottle. Pours amber wit off-white head. Aroma is floral hops, caramel malt and citrus. Flavor is hoppy with notes of citrus and pine with nice caramel malt backbone. Mouthfeel is medium with good carbonation. Nice hoppy amber ale. Very good session ale. Thanks to abcfan for this one.
Bottle. Pours amber with an off white head. The aroma has floral hops and caramel malt. The flavor is very well balanced with a solid dose of floral hops and nice sweet caramel notes. Very nice.

Draft @ Mad Mex: Gosh, this brewery is just really hit or miss for me.  Duh, pours orange-amber with a very thick and aromatic head, like circus peanuts (the orange candy).  Has the bittersweetness of ruby red grapefruit.  Nice, sweet hoppiness to it, definitely drinkable, but smell is throwing me off.  Almost smells like pixie stix powder.
user_location: I F&ckin hate those guys from, Ohio, USA

text: Bottle.  Pours deep clear amber, with a small beige head.  Aroma of citrus, sweet malt, and bread.  Taste was hoppy and heavy on the malt.  Very flavorful and drinkable.  Finish is lightly bitter.  Very solid.  Mouth is lightly carbonated and smooth.

Very nice amber ale. Pours a deep amber with a small, evanescent beige head. Good lacing. Nose is a moderate mixture of pine and grapefruit, with a light overtone of yeast and bread. Taste is a coppery bitter melange of pine and caramel malt, with a little salt thrown in. Mouthfeel is slick and the finish reiterates the salt (but in a good way), and is fairly astringent with a great long bitter echo.

Oh man this beer will cure what ails ya! Ripe grapefruit scent with plenty of lemon and pine on top of a layer of sweet caramel and roasted nuts. Dark amber almost brown in color with a 1 lasting head and heavy lacing. Middle of the road fullness, drinkable and it sticks with you. Crisp and snappy with a mild bitterness. Explosive flavor that tickles the buds. Lightly burnt malt that is nutty and has a good caramel taste. Fresh wheat bread and plenty of flowery hops providing a blast of citrus and evergreen. Astounding treat, I need a whole lot more of this around.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2010 On Tap at Troegs.  candied hop/floral aroma, golden amber body with medium head. well balanced as it starts of sweet with a candied pine flavor, with subtle grapefruit and a light bitter aftertaste
A refreshing beer.  A slight brown color with nice lacing on the glass.  Has a nice nutty hoppy taste and finishes very smooth.  An impressive brewery.
Nut brown color with a slightly off white, almost almond head.  good lacing and nice nutty aroma.  solid hop profile but not overpowering for the style.  very drinkable

Nice hop aroma, with hints of citrus and freshly cut grass, backed with caramel malts.  Pours a reddish-amber with a quickly fading light tan head.  Nice chewy palate, full of hoppy goodness.  Nice solid amber.
A nicely done amber backed up with a large amount of hops that compliments the malty body nicely.  Easy to drink and enjoyable.  No complaints.
Pours amber with thin off white head.  Aroma of hops and malt.  Taste is hops, malt, and caramel.  Decent brew.

Thick, firm, beige metallic-tasting head. Dark amber body. Fruity smell that is saying drink me. Taste of hops and easy drinkin. Beer, like other Troegs, is kind of salty. Really easy to sit around and drink this fine example of an amber ale though.

Draught
Local pub just got this in. Brilliant dark copper color. Aroma mixed of hops and malt but not hop assertive as name would imply. Nice hop flavor evident but not much else. This was served way too cold.
Pour is a clear amber body with a thin but lasting tan head. Some citrus with a really nice biscuit-like malt flavor. Nice balance - easy to drink.

Pours a dark amber color with a thick and creamy off-white head and excellent lacing.  This beer has a fantastic combination of citrus and floral hops, balanced with caramel malt.  The hops are heavy in the aroma and palate.  The finish is strong and lingering, but not at all too bitter - very well balanced beer.  Another impressive beer from the Troeg brothers.

Bottle pours a bold amber color with an off white head.  Has an earthy, spicy, and malty aroma.  Has a medium body.  Flavor is bold malt upfront with a spicy and flowery finish.  Overall, the aroma was not overwhelmingly good, the flavor was just ok, and this is an overall boring beer.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours red/amber, short though lasting off-white head.  Slight lacing.  Aroma of citrus/spice/floral, in that order,hops.  Flavor is sweet caramel malt, nicely countered by mildly pungent grapefruit.  Tingly on front of tongue, sweet & sour over the middle, grapefruity towards back.  Medium body, dry finish.  Little aftertaste of malt and citrus.  Very nicely built amber ale!

9/22/2008: Tröegs HopBack Amber Ale has a rich amber color and a thick, deep beige head. It is clear and sparkling and overall it’s a very attractive beer. The fresh, hoppy aroma is spicy, floral, earthy and contains a bit of caramel sweetness. An adequately sweet, caramel maltiness is well-accompanied by a really fresh, dry hoppiness and mild to moderate bitterness. The beer is even more dry through the finish which just beckons me back for another drink. All of this wonderful aroma and flavor is matched with a smooth, and medium-bodied palate. Wow, I could drink bottle after bottle of this for months on end and enjoy every one! This is an excellent Amber Ale! 12 fl. oz. bottle (6% alc/vol.) from Tmoney99. Thanks Tom! Rating #526 for this beer...
Another tasty concoction from Troegs.  What can you say about these guys other than... totally solid.

Draft from Pacific Standard in Brooklyn. Dark amber pour with small creamy head. Hops, caramel, toffee, and some fruitiness on the nose and palate.  Nice malt presence. This is very much a tasty amber ale with plenty of hops to keep it interesting.  Would love to have a sixer of this one to take home.

Having been impressed by other Troegs offerings, I find myself confused with this one. Prickly with a spicy, bitter bite are the nice aspects. But overall this has an overpowering maltiness that is too heavy and sweet, while having a unpleasant vegetable aftertaste.
Unbalanced and not refreshing and wont lend itself to pair well with most foods.

12 oz bottle, Queens. Very impressed by this one- exceeded all expectations. Appearance is a dark almost cola-like color with very little foam. Hoppy aroma is noticeable along with hints of coffee and caramel and malt. Taste is also very hoppy and is sweet with just a hint of bitterness. Smooth palate despite the hop character and fills the mouth with flavor. Kind of stumbled upon this one- very drinkable and i will get it again.

Bottle.  Faint malt aroma.  Brown color with thick head, and lots of lacing and sheeting in the glass.  The taste is a great combination of sweet and roasted malt, with some caramel and citrus, and an orange peel bitterness at the end.  Great stuff.

12 oz bottle...slightly cloudy medium brown with a beige head....citrus and malts in a lovely sweet balance for the nasal passages...floral hops smell delicious...refreshing body with a delicate bulk of substance...the same nice blend of malt and hop in the mouth...throughout this entire beer the fresh hops are present, I dig it...malty finish with some light toffee

12oz bottle.  Bottled 8/12/08.  The color of this beer is amber.  Brilliantly clear with a big soapy white head with plentiful lace.  Aroma is biscuity, hoppy, slightly burnt toast though not unpleasant, turkey.  Smells like Avery IPA or a less intense DFH 90.  Taste is smooth, light, with low bitterness.  A bit watery though not unpleasant really.  A slight hint of caramel comes through in the taste but the sweetness in general is kept in check. Could be a good session beer.  Ambers are kind of boring to me and this one didn’t really change my mind though I wouldn’t mind drinking a large amount of these.  I much prefer the Nugget Nectar but this isn’t bad.

Pours a ruby brown in color that is translucent.  About quarter inch of head/froth forms on the pour.  Smell is a nice balance.  First all malt, then deeper some hops appear.  There’s also some sort of spice notes as well.  Taste is very resinous.  Not overly bitter, but hop flavor.  Don’t know how to exactly describe it.  Plenty of a malt backbone to support it.  This is different than anything I’ve had of the style.  Decent mouthfeel, but a tad cloying.  Glad to see Troegs in Ohio.

Interesting, poured a dark copper color with a thick of white head that had nice lacing.  Aroma was a mix of pine notes and some caramel notes.  Flavor seemed to have a big hop bite initially and rich cloying sweetness in the finish.  A rich palate. A good beer that at times seemed to be overdone.  Hops seemed to mask flavors rather than complement.

I’ve been drinking this all the time lately.  I love the smooth, thick, dry mouthfeel and the toasted chocolaty flavor.  It’s got just a light bitter hoppy note that comes through in the finish deliciously.

(Bottle, Oliver Twist, Stockholm) Dark amber colour with brief, foamy, beige head. Malty, fruity nose with dark fruit, caramel, toffee and slightly rubbery hops. Malty taste with notes of dark fruit, caramel, toffee, hints of chocolate and spicy but modest bitterness in the finish. Nice, but lacking something extra.

12 ounce bottle in pint glass.  Clear amber with lasting head.  Citrus aroma.  Mild carmael with bracing and dry bitter finish.  Medium body and carbo.  Sure its tasty, but is it an amber ale or just a copper colored IPA.  You cant just bury everything in fresh hops.  I sometimes think you could fresha nd dry hop a Belgian white and it would score a 91 here.  This is a good beer, but I prefer and amber to be very caramel and toasty and malty and biscuity, not an IPA with caramel coloring.

Very happy with this one. This is my idea of a session beer. Everything about this beer is simply good. Reminds me of a souped up Yuengling with better color, taste, everything, the works. Hopheads should enjoy this one, overall better brew than 60 Minute IPA
Pours a dark amber with a big tan head. Lot’s of hops and a little malt in the aroma. Nice hop flavor but not overpowering. A very drinkable beer.

Copper colored with a beige head that retains pretty well and leaves decent lacing behind.  Smell is full of resinous hops; pineapple, pine, and has some nice malt behind it too, very tropical.  Bitter hops greet the tongue, a bit grassy, but leads into some resinous pine and caramel.  Medium carbonation and body.  I’d like a little more hops in the taste to accompany the aroma, but it’s still a good beer.

Dark amber/copper with a light head.  Very light flowery hop aroma (note: this was tasted with cloged sinuses, maybe not totally appreciated, worth a second try.)  Mouthfeel is a little fizzy and carbonated.   Flavor is very crisp, light citrus and flowery hops.  The grassy biterness is not great, and it lingers and overpowers the weak flavor.  Not my favorite, but worth trying again with clear sinuses.
UPDATED: AUG 12, 2011 Wonderful aroma, sweet and smooth, slight bitter finish.  Very much looking forward to my next one!

355 ml bottle. Red/brown body with a descent beige head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel and fruity hops. Well-balanced, sweet malt, some caramel and a sharp clean hop flavor. Straight forward well made amber.

Poured from a bottle dated  06.19.08 at about 40 degrees.  Half an inch of of off-white head that dissipated a little too quickly.  A very nice dark amber-red color.  A sweet and subtle aroma -- a little too subtle for my taste.  It had a perfect amount of hoppiness and a very smooth, almost syrupy body.  Pumpkin and toffee notes and a pleasantly dry finish.  Precisely what keeps me from disparaging this beer also keeps me from praising it; it’s too subtle in many ways, almost intentionally restrained, though that may be the result of it being below optimal temperature.  All in all, though, a picture-perfect example of a quality amber ale.
Very nice amber with loads of hops and caramel malts.  I was pleasantly surprised by this one.
I am not a fan of amber ale’s but this one is decent. I don’t enjoy the bitter amber tastes that most of these beers have.

Had this beer both on tap and in the bottle. Enjoyed it throughly each way. Appeared a nice clear brown. A grassy hop smell with caramel malt. The taste is the same as the aroma. The hops are not as strong as the name would suggest, but still a very good session beer.

12 oz. bottle - purchased at New Beer in NYC; dark amber with foaming white head that quickly fades; huge hops aromas are sweet, juicy and thick; drinks with considerably hoppiness, but also with the sweet, caramel of the amber ale base; on the strong side, but tasty for sure

Nice hops taste, but coming from a keg of Dogfish 90 minute it paled in comparison.  A good summer/fall beer and crowd pleaser.
Nice burnt caramel color.

Bottle. Translucent ruby-mahogany with thin, off-white head. Enticing hoppy, juicy and malty nose all at once. Hints of citrus and chocolate in aroma. Fruity bitterness carries a slightly caramel-sweet tinge for balance. Nothing overpowering, maybe a little discordant, but tasty and pretty refreshing.

Bottle courtesy of GMCC2181.  Pours a super dark, clear amber with one finger tan head and great lacing.  Nose is sweet caramel and floral hops.  Taste is caramel up front with a nice bitter hop finish.  Medium mouth feel.  Decent amber  thanks G-Money!

Bottle. Pours a clear, deep amber with a small bubbly off-white head that shows decent retention and leaves only a hint of lacing.  Smell is big on floral hops with a big pine presence on top of a sweet caramel malt base.  The taste is a slightly more balanced version of the smell with a more subdued floral and pine hop kick up front that is balanced really well by the sweet caramel malts.  Mouthfeel is medium and very creamy with good carbonation and only the slightest hop bitterness.  This is a very well balanced amber with just the right amount of hops to give it a good kick.  Very nice.

Poured a dark copper red with a good tan foamy head. There was light lacing. A hoppy pine/grassy aroma with a nice mild hop taste and slight caramel sweetness which blended well with the hint of bitterness on the finish. There was a good flavor and an easy drinkable enjoyable beer. The 4th beer in the variety pack tried.

bottle.  Pours a dark amber color with a small-ish head that clears to leave a thin layer and ring.  Aromas of orange peels, lemons, and caramel.  Flavors of sharp citrus hops, grapefruits, and a good amount of smooth toasted caramel.  Bitterness is medium but assertive.  Full bodied and even on the palate, with a crisp clean finish.  Solid amber ale.

Pours a dark amber, almost brown color. No head. Aroma of sugar and small amount of hops. I wasnt sure what to expect from this beer... But the taste was sweet. I can taste the hops but they arent the bitter hops that I am used to. Brown sugar, cararmel, and some spiceyness thrown in. Unique beer... Smooth and easy to drink. I cant quite put my finger on everything in this beer but I like it. TRY IT!

pours a clear rich amber with a thin head on the tan side of white. smells floral and a lot like tropical fruit... pineapple, grass, orange, pine, grain and a bit of savory yeast.
the flavor is rich and malty balanced with rosemary-like pine hops, orange, earth, spice and a dry yeasty finish. nice light bitterness throughout. slick mouth feel, medium body and sharp bubbles.
Pours brown-amber color with small near-white head. Clean hop aroma dominated by flowers. Taste is sweet with caramel but lasting bitterness. Very drinkable if simple.

Pours a beautiful clear amber colour with a frothy beige head that leaves a thick coating of lacing as it fades. The aroma is rich with rich, earthy caramel, peppery spice, citric hops and hints of resin. The flavour is rich and chewy with a massive caramel malt backbone that balances out a very fresh tasting citric hop profile. The palate is full, moderately carbonated and a bit syrupy, with a long, sweet finish.

Deep amber color with decent head.  moderate citris hoppy aroma.  Resinous hops dominates a malty background.  This is a gender confused beer that cant decide if it wants to be a red ale or a pale ale.  Almost like a watered down double pale ale.

pours deep amber. thin, dense tan head lingers for a while. lacing is thick at each level the beer sits at. kinda fun looking. aroma is heavy grapefruit, floral notes. caramel maltiness too. taste is rich-an onslaught of caramel maltiness followed by the floral citrus of the hops. nutty, spicy finish.
Dark amber with off-white head.  Citrus floral hop aroma.  Slightly malty with grapefruit/citrus hop flavor.  On tap at The Shep.
Hoppy aroma with light hints of sweet malt. Red-orange color with s light amount of tan foam. Sweet malt beginning with a hoppy finish. Lightly creamy palate.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2009 Had this beer on draft at Magoos.  What a great beer for hop heads.  Big aroma and floral flavor, funncky, sweet sour and a nice though not too bitter finish.  dark amber color and good levelof carbonation and head.
again in 2009, still well balanced for a well hopped ale

Pours a reddish brown with red highlights and a fair fading tan head.  Smells fresh hoppy, very similar to their pale ale.  Tastes is floral piney hop with a malty backbone.  Medium body with a nutty finish.  Pretty good
Pours amber with a thin off white head.  Aroma is caramel and a bit of hop citrus.  Flavor is the same,  some funk and skunk as well.  Finishes mildly bitter.

Deep amber almost brown in color.  The nose has aromas of sweet caramel, light citrus and stewed fruit.  In the mouth it is medium-bodied and shows off the hops even in the midpalate which fades toward a soft, dry finish.

Bottle.  Pours an amber/brown with a nice tan head.  Aroma of sweet malt and flowery hops.  Flavor of bitter flavory hops, light fruits.  Very flowery (like soap!).   I would like a stronger malt presence along with the strong hop addition.  Still, a very enjoyable amber.
Bottle. Aroma combining piney hops, diverse fruity esters, and rich malt. Flavor loses some of the diversity of the aroma, as some notes blend together, but still quite tasty. Very nice.
it looks brown. smells like red grapes and oranges and hops. tastes like it too. bumpy ride. slimy finish. but flavorful, alas.

Bottle acquired as a bonus from mcferc4.  Thanks again Rob!!!  Crimson body with an eggshell colored head.  Flavor is caramel and toffee but packs a bit of a hop punch that differentiates it from most ambers.  The hops arent in the same league as Lucky 13, Green Flash Hop Head Red, or Speakeasy Prohibition but they are there.  Very tasty.  Wish I could get more from this brewery.
Pours a clear amber body with a thin sized head, a nice amount of caramel malts and floral hop aroma. Taste was soft, citrusy with subtle hop character all the way through. Finishes off dry.
From bottle... poured beautiful dark amber with medium creamy white head. Nice pine and citrus aroma. Sweet and spicy flavor. Loved it!

Dark amber appearing brown, somewhat clear with clingy covering of tan head.

Smells of resiny pine and citrus hops jump out with some roasted barley and toasty caramel.

Sweet and citrusy with toasty caramalts. Pretty well balanced with the pine and citrus hop bitterness throughout, but never coming off astringent.  Amber for hop-heads.

Somewhat smooth feel, moderate-medium body for amber, but still feels a little thin.  Very drinkable amber.
Nice beer. Pours dark copper off-white head.  Nice hop taste with good balance.  Right amount of carbonation which makes it a very drinkable beer.
From a bottle, pours a amber color.  Great hop taste.  Nothing seems out of place in this beer, well balanced.  great sessional beer.

medium bitterness, light body, fizzy, bitter,

 A little too bitter in my opinion. Not too heavy though.  I prefer the aroma to the flavor. Not a beer Id drink solo at the end of the day, but certainly it would be good paired with a meal.
Bottle courtesy of abcfan, pours dark amber with half finger white head. Aroma is not strong but some sweet malt and light hops.  Taste is similar to aroma with clean finish. Really good beer.
Out of a sixter. Really quality stuff. Dark amber color with a large head. Great aroma of pine and citrus. Just a wonderful hop flavor with a very good balance.

On tap, this poured a good dark amber color, with a good whiteish head. Great hop smell, with a great hop taste, not to overpowering. Had a good malt bite also present. The head was perfect all the way down the glass. I would buy It again.

Best session beer i ever had!Beautiful hop aroma with slight grapefruit maybe a very slight spice and good solid caramel malt backbone.Flavor perfectly matching the aroma.Not to bitter but yet very hoppy.Good complexity but very drinkable.
Very well balanced.Beautiful deep amber color with a thick off white head with very good lacing.Also a very pleasant soft carbonation.Excellent beer for summer or fall.Can drink quite a few in one sitting even at 6% abv.Excellent job troegs!
This beer is more like an APA.  Strong hop presence combined with a sweet caramel taste and mild citrus flavors make it very enjoyable.  Possibly the best beer they make.

Purchased at Total Wine in Alexandria, 12 oz bottle pours ruby amber in color with little head. Aroma of caramel and roasted grains. Front palate of warm malt with spicy (nutmeg, cinnamon, clove?) middle and finish of mild but crisp hoppiness to give a well rounded flavor. Easily paired with a variety of light to mid-weight fare. Great for a spring, summer or autumn session beer.
Amber color with white head.  Nice hoppy aroma.  Caramel malt taste with nice bitter Hop taste.

Purchased at Perfect Pour - Dark shiny copper, creamy off white head.  Toffee peach aromas ride light toasty pine notes.  Soft hoppy flavor balances on a rich caramel backbone.  Medium bodied, soft carbonation, lightly bittersweet finish.  6% ABV makes this a decent cross-over session ale in my book...

Love this brew.  Pours amber in color with a thin white head.  Aroma is amazing, smells of sweet malt and sugary fruit.  Taste is very fruity and hoppy with nice carbonation.  Crisp finish.  Makes a nice session beer.

Bottle: pours a dark brown with a little bit of head, aroma of hops and maybe a little caramel, taste is hoppy, spicy, caramel.  This is more my type of a session beer - has some hops coming through but not overpowering and a reasonable ABV.
Liked it alot, good hoppy tastse, nice color and aroma, started with a bang and finished well.
Loved it!  Nice hoppy kick, but well balanced with the rest of the beer.  Havent had a Troegs yet that I didnt love.
So so flavor. It was interesting that the hops were present in smell, but the beer wasnt bitter. I would purchase this one again
Bottle.  Pours a dark amber color with minimal off-white head.  Citrus aroma is a preview to the flavor of hops that comes across the tongue with spiciness.  Not overpowering, and very sessionable.
Dark amber/copper color.  Nice beige head, but dissipates quickly.  Citrus/grapefruit cascade hop aroma and flavor.  Some caramel malt.  Thin.

Pours red amber with an off-white head. Aroma is hoppy with a bit of malt sweetness. Flavor is also hoppy with a nice balancing malt character. Decent body. Flavors are good but not bold enough to be great.

Very clear and beautiful maple amber color with an inch of thick off-white head. Aroma of sweet, almost caramel, pine hops. Sweetness is there with a mild caramel at first, but the hop finish is unpronounced. It starts to transition to the slightly bitter hops and then just falls off. I like the body though and I think its still a good beer.

This is a nice amber with a bold hop character.  The aroma is hops with some sweet malt and mild yeast.  Flavor is nice and hopy with citrus and pine and a mild floral note.  Finish is a bit sticky but not in a negative way.  I like this beer and continue to buy it a few times a year.
Hoppy!  Not too much, though, so I can stand it!  Not a refresher... good with dinner... like hamburgers!  Yum.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2008 Clear brown with a red tint and a long-lasting white head.  Sweet floral hop aroma with some yeasty undertones.  Hints of citrus fruit and malt.  Malty grainy flavor with some hops.  Sweet honey flavor with a touch of bitterness on the end..  Very smooth and easy to drink.  Good carbonation.  Excellent easy to drink beer.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2008 Somebody needs to tell the Troegs brothers to reevaluate this recipe.  About two years ago I had this I liked, nice solid classic tasting amber ale.  Last week, because I had not had it in about four months I grabbed a six pack - holy crap WHAT HAPPENED! Way too much hops, way too much. Very sweet, too sugary grapefruity taste, not balanced.
Pours deep copper color with a good head. Spicy hop aroma. It has a great spicy hop taste and a malt finish.

This beer looks great, a clear ruby body with a decent off-white head. Smells of hops, but fruity (not citrus) and a little malt. The flavor is hop-dominated, but not quite bitter enough and its a little watery.

Bottled. An elegant aromatic bouquet. Pours a dark umber hue with creamy opalescent head.  Ambrosial profuse flavor; mellifluous malt succeeded by a perfect efflorescent hop presence with hints of vanilla and a slight bitter nuttiness.

Bottle: Deep amber with a brown hue topped by a quickly fading light tan head. Nose has some caramelized British malts and some fruity aromatic qualities of mild American hops and a nutty hint as well. Slightly over carbonated. The flavor has a light fruity hop touch upfront with dried orange peel followed by a nutty character. The finish has a dark toastiness and a prolonged bitterness. Kind of lacking depth.

Troegs HopBack Amber Ale
ABV: 6%
IBU:
Calories: 160
Volume: 12 fl oz
Glass: shaker
Purchased at: Troegs Sampler at Shop Rite Liquors in Hamilton NJ
Consumed on/at: 12:30am on Saturday March 8th, 2008

sensory first impression: Mountainous head - like a hilly landscape. Off white head. Aroma is very nice. Some light carbonated activity, and that same reddish sunset color. This beer isnt watery like many Troegs. It has a fuller feel, though not like many of may favorites, it is quite acceptably good. Lacing, taste, color, and flavor all come together nicely here. ABV is right on the money. Starting to wish the sampler had been a 12 pack of these. Lacing is increasingly beautiful. Head hangs on at a .25 inch.

Aroma/Olfactory:
Malt flavor is: Caramel, a bit of chocolate, and flowery.
Hop flavor is: flowery, herby.
Yeast flavor is: sourdough.
Other flavors include: hints of vanilla and spices.

Visuals/Appearance:
Color is: bright amber red. Nice color.
Liquid is: clear, and clean.
Head and lace are: bumpy, white, and lacy.

Taste/Flavor:
Maltiness or Sweetness level is: medium to heavy.
Hoppiness or Bitterness level is: light to medium.
Sour level is: light

Palate/Tactile:
Body or Mouthfeel is: medium.
Texture is: creamy, sticky
Carbonation is: average, active.
Finish is: long, enjoyable, and more so as time goes on.

Overall experience: The best of the sampler by far, but really the only enjoyable beer, and there are far better hoppy beers out there. Ill repeat it here. look at Victory, Stone, and Rogue to understand what its really all about, then find a way to innovate, and youll have something.

Thanks abcfan.  The color was amber/brown.  The head was thin and off-white.  The aroma was hoppy and sweet.  The flavor was the same.  The palate was thin and lightly carbonated.  The finish was hoppy.

Thanks abcfan. Pours a copper orange with a two finger creamy orange head. Nice hoppy aroma, citrusy, sweet floral aroma. The flavor is very sweet and citrusy, nice caramel and a waxy mouthfeel. A nice amber. Had the same problem as Nugget Nectar for me, the mouthfeel was a little dead, kind of thin and no liveliness.
Troegs makes some fine craft beer but I do not like this for the pungent pine aroma alone.  Great pour and color, decent body but the flower hops method just over kill to me.  Just not my bag baby.
(USA) Amber color with Sm-White Head. Beer had a Grassy/Pine Aroma!!!  Strong Grapefruit taste. Not for me!!

Draught at Hop Devil, NYC. Deep golden/amber color, offwhite head. Toffe aroma at fist, some fruit and some hops. Floral flavor, citric, fruity, elder notes, grassy, metallic, perfumje notes. Hoppy, grassy finish.

Thanks to abcfan for the bottle! Great stuff! Pours out a nice deep copper color with a great head. Aroma is of spicy hops. The taste and palate are the best part of this beer. It has a great spicy hop taste with a malty clean finish. Its a great version of the style.

The BEST amber ale, anywhere, period .
A fine balance of every parameter beer can have and then some ...
Get some if  you can find it .
A good reference standard for the style .
Draft.  Wow, a great beer with not too much hoppines and tons of caramel/chocolately goodnsss. Lovable.

Aroma is quite hoppy, seems to be a touch of malt.  Beer is clear, with a small head a few minutes after pouring.  Good color for an amber.  Flavor is quite hoppy, a good amount of bitterness, all well balanced with the malt flavor.  Like an amber IPA.

Deep copper color with a frothy off-white head.  Caramel/toffee malt, sweet fruit and citrus hops in the aroma.  Smooth and rich caramel flavor laced with a piquant hop bitterness.  Fine and clean resin, even minty finish.  Medium to full bodied.  Very nice, substantially flavored amber ale.
dark amber with a copper head. nose is fruity and full of hops. nice balanced flavor with notes of grapefruit and malt sweetness. dry perfumey finish.

bottle. smells like pinesol, Tons of hops and fruit in the smell. red/brown no head ,good lacing. tastes like grapefruit and a peach tea with a touch of lemon cleaner. palate is pretty good despite the strong taste.

Pours a rick amber color with a small whit head. Aroma is citrus hops. Very well balanced flavor of sweet malts and hops. Not bad at all. Lots of hop flavor without a lot of bitterness? Very strange but good.
Troegs HopBack Amber Ale is a good hoppy, yet balanced, amber ale with a white head.

12 oz bottle.  Deep amber coloured brew with a thick white head.  Aroma is great... bright juicy hop aroma.  Grapefruit and lots of spicy sweetness.  A lovely caramel/cookie dough malt base with a hint of toast as well.  Excellent balance.  Tasty sweet citrus hops over a fresh biscuity malt base.  Moderate bitterness, but loads of hop flavour.

Clear amber with a frothy tan head. Nice spicy hop smell with bready malts. Med bodied with a super smooth mouthfeel. Good taste is well balanced with caramel malt and a nice piney spicy hop bitterness to finish. A regular in my fridg. 71406
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: This beer is the definition of balance.  Rich caramel flavor balanced out with fruity hops.  Very nice.

Ehhh...just didnt do it for me.  Pour was dark amber, little head or lacing.  The flavor was heavy grapefruit with some caramel/toffee sweetness that seemed out of place.  I just didnt like it.  Got even sweeter and more grapefruity as it warmed and the two flavors just didnt "go" in my opinion.
Pours a nice dark amber color w/ a slight head. Light hoppy aroma, had a light taste with a bit of a pine in the after taste. Very drinkable, will definitely have again.

Tasting @ Capones:  Poured a dark amber color with not a lot of head.  The aroma was that of dirt and hops.  The flavor had some sweetness like caramel with a nice balance of hops.  Over all of our favorites at this tasting.
Very nice floral hop with a rich amber malt. This was highly drinkable and very pleasant. One of the better ambers I have had.
The beer has a slightly dark amber body topped off with a pretty thick white head.  It has aromas of orange from what seems to be fresh hop. There is a very floral flavor with hints of green tea.
very tasty - is it really true to style given all the hops?  who cares, its great

Bottle, thanks to TomDecapolis! Pours clear amber with a lacy off-white head. Medium-light body and carbonation. In both the aroma and taste, the pine and citrus of the hops battle the toffee and caramel of the malt. Neither one comes out a clear winner, but its a tasty draw. This is usually one of the ho-hum beer styles, but Tröegs does a nice job with this one. Can you say "Sessionable?" Sure you can.

I think I had a bad bottle. Ill rerate after I have another. Poured dark amber with nice size off white head. Light aroma of malt. Very harsh alcohol taste. Some malt flavor to start but then the alcohol just dominated after a second. Undrinkable.

On tap at Brickwall in Asbury. Pour is a nice deep amber with a small light head. Aroma of citrus, hops and some spice. Flavor is similiar. Nice hop bit with citrus and a malty sweetness near the end. Like this one. Been wanting to try it then ran into it at Brickwall. Liked it alot.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2008 All right - another 4 pointer!  This one is a hoppy amber from Pennsylvania, in a 12 ounce bottle.  The label has a close-up drawing of some hops on it - shows what this brewer is aiming for.  There is a pleasantly sharp aroma, with hops and floral notes.  The brew is a dark amber color, with a very nice flavor.  It is fresh and robust, with caramel malty sweetness blended nicely with piney hops.  Well-balanced, full-flavored, delicious!

1-4-08 bottle shared with fly and lb4lb thanks to kmweaver!  
Thick amber color with nice white head and lacing.  Nice subtle hoppy smells.  Decent mouthfeel.  A hint thin but not bad at all - I would have it again.  Bitter and hoppy taste that is quite enjoyable in this amber.

Nice hop aroma and a deep burnt red look to this beer.  Its not to malty, but this allows a massive hop presence to show itself.  Troegs does it again with this one.  This finishes with a touch of sweetness and very little hop bitterness.

On draft at beer club.  Pours a deep amber with a bit of a reddish hue.  Has a foamy 1-finger head.  Has a floral hop nose with a small hint of citrus and some pine.  For some reason, this beer makes me think of hiking (possibly because it is packaged with the Rugged Trail a lot) but it has a really great piney hops that goes very well with that image.  There is a little bit of an artificial pineapple taste as well.  A little bit of a malt character, but it is completely dominated by the hops.  Has a good thick body with a good bitter caramel finish.

I really like and appreciate Troegs. Perhaps I would lose this facination in a blind tasting, perhaps not. Would like to think that perhaps I would see all that I perceive to be true no matter what. At least I know for sure they make some awesome beers and that I liked tghis one rather well as I drank from it and saw what would quite easily be a session beer, had I that pleasure.
I thank Deniz & Etin for the pleasure of sharing

bottle courtesy of kmweaver.  Thanks!
Rich amber pour with a small offwhite head and a balanced nose of hops and malt.  Found it a bit watery and slightly thin, but with a decent balanced flavor and what seemed to be some alcohol peeking through.  Nice and drinkable, but not quite what I was expecting.

Pours a nice amber color with a good white head that hung around for a while.  Aroma is hoppy and begs you to drink it.  Flavor is of caramel that is balanced by the hoppiness.  This is smooth and drinkability is high.  This improved drastically as it warmed.  This is a nice beer.  Will have again.

Pours a deep mahogany amber color with an ivory head.  Very sweet and floral hop aroma, especially for an amber ale.  The taste is full but very clean--caramel and spicy hops.  Nice bitter finish.  Solid beer, and refreshing in more ways than one.

Pours a reddish amber with a thin white lace head. Smells crisp with floral hops, a nice boquet indeed. Tastes of refeshing malt, fresh hops. This is verrry smooth and a delight. Has qualities from my favorite Troegs, Nugget Nectar. For an amber red this is a gem. Great drinkability.
This is my fallback beer.  Love it.  The drinkability and the palate are what makes it.
Nice and very hoppy. Almost tastes like an APA but with a nice maltyness to it. Pours a copper hazey grapfruit color. Some citrus evident.

Bottled.  Poured clear, deep amber with a short-lived cap of off-white head.  The aroma had some juicy light-medium skinned fruits, grapefruit, and caramel.. well-hopped with sufficient maltage to back it up.. nice!  The flavor had a bunch of fruit and caramel at the core with juicy grapefruit and some spicy bitterness around.. bright and lightly-toasted.. tasty!  Light-medium bodied with a thicker middle and a short, grainy bitter finish.. a bit tacky at times, and the slightest bit stale.  Still a solid beer overall.

Pours a dark amber color with a nice off white head. Aromas of malt and some hops. Nice biiter hop flavor to start things off,very nicely balanced with a sweet caramel malt backing.Nice smooth hop/bitter finish to it.Very good! Thanks Ubamartian!

Bottle. Pours an amber, very slight haze, small white head. Aroma was dominated by hops, but not over the top, maybe a touch of caramel. Flavor was slightly sweet, hops again, caramel and grapefruit hidden in the background.

A scary dark amber color, balanced malt and hop aroma,thought for sure the hops would knock me off my chair,but that didnt happen,taste was a surprisingly sweet malt and lots of bittering hops,alright flavoring hops do become more evident on about the third tip .A wonderful malt hop balance, each has a lot to say to you, really interesting. Thanks a ton Ubamartian
Cask @ Rustico in Alexandria VA.  Pours pretty dark cloudy copper.  Nice big hoppy nose on this one.  Taste is sweet hoppy, chewy with a nice hoppy bite and a malty edge.
Bottle. Pours reddish brown w/ a sudsy head. Malty caramel-ish hoppy aroma. Exceptionally smooth taste with a great hoppy/sweet balance. Kinda tastes honeyish. Delicious.

Hopback is a fitting name for this beer - the aroma is unmistakeably of hops, and there is only a slight amount of bitterness.  There is also a taste of citrus and flowers.  This is a surprisingly good brew, very hoppy.

12 oz. bottle. Clear coppery hue under a medium light beige head leaving a decent lace. Aroma of light brown sugar, grain, peppery spice. Medium body with a pleasing light chewiness. Mostly caramel sweetness up front with a very soft bitterness coming in at the end. Finish is balanced, with a slowly developing dryness. This is a pretty good amber. It has some character, whereas most ambers are non-descript.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008 very nice piney/floral aroma, large shaving cream, lacing off white head, copper in color. BUT, the flavor here dissapoints, and has a noticably flat character. Not as sharp or as dry as I like in a beer that starts off with so much promise. draft- really enjoyed a caramel like flavor and mouthfeel at first that opened up into a great and bright hop presentation. I was wrong with the bottle rate- WAY wrong.
Amber pour with a nice white head. Dark spicy hop flavor with some pleasantly smooth caramel maltiness. Dry finish. Excellent.

12oz.  Another winner from Troegs.  Pours hazy amber with a fleeting beige head.  Good roasted amber malt, with some relatively complex spiciness and hops.  Good mouthfeel that turns a bit thin towards the end.  I feel like "amber ale" is one of the more stratified classifications and this is definitely on the hoppier end of things.
Highly citrus aroma with a really deep color considering its medium malt taste.  Strong grapefruit citrus that doesnt linger too long and is neatly balanced by medium body and quick dry finish.

Tasty on tap... other than I had this just before Scratch #4... I thought it was hoppy. However, its well balanced, but too bitter for me to act as a session beer. However, having it server at the brewery was a treat because, with hopped ales, its best served fresh. Nice mouthfeel (not to chewy, not too thin), well balanced taste, albeit a bitt more hop bitter than a traditional amber ale. (On Tap 10/13/2007)

This has become one of my favorite beers.  It pours a deep copper color with a thick, white head.  The aroma is wonderful, full of floral/citrusy/spicy hop notes.  The flavor is very hoppy, but it is a citrusy/grapefruit flavor, with just a tiny bit of bitterness.  I find this to be a very distinctive, very enjoyable beer.
Red in color with little translucense.  You can spell the hops long before your first sip.  The taste is very much what the aroma suggests.  It is a nice hoppy beer with a smooth finish.

From the bottle into pint glass. I was immediately impressed with the BIG hoppy aroma during the pour. Nice thick head slowly dissipated with lingering lace. True to its name, this beer is full of hop flavor. Slightly bitter finish, but not overly so. Mouthfeel left me wanting a little, but, overall, a nice beer.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2009 Not the best of the Troeg products by any means, but certainly a decent beer, especialy for a low price everyday beer.Mainly notes of caramel and such with some grapefruit notes as well but nothing special

wow that is nice. very clean wood accent with a beautiful tasting hop character that includes floral pine and grapefruit rind accents in very good proportion. beer is really creamy yet refreshng (probably the beautiful flavor). wow thats a nice substantive and really classy brew. no hint of alcohol.

Troegs doesnt disappoint with lovers of light hoppy beers with this one.  Nice light start with a very hoppy aftertaste.  Light color and texture give away later to a good strong aftertaste that leaves you craving more.

poured into a pint.  pours a bubbly red copper amber with good white head.  sweet hoppy aroma.  smooth malty front with sweet hoppy backgrounds to a light finish.  not much bitterness from hops, but sweet lingering aftertaste.  good, yet more aromatic than flavor from the hops, light and sessionable.

Bottle. Pours copper with thin but tight offwhite head. The aroma is floral hops with some honey and citrus notes and light biscuit. The flavor is biscuit and toast malt witha  pretty assertive hop profile for an amber. Mostly pine, some lemon notes, too. It gets some caramel in the finish with a mild spice and earth aftertaste.
From a bottle poured amber with a good amount of head.  Nice hoppy flavor, kinda sweet, with nice lasting aftertaste.

A rotten fruit laced floral piny aroma, a little scary. Transparent iced tea appearance. Also has an iced tea, tea froth head. Fruity hop bite.  Of course the hops are the main feature here. Small amount of creamy carbonation.  wants to be an IPA but never quite gets there. Citrus rind flavors build thru the session. Dirty hop spring water finish. Will not buy again.  Gets a seven overall only because it is troeg.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle courtesy of Steph: Poured a deep copper color ale with a big foamy white head with some good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of floral and bitter hops is dominating. Taste is a mix between light caramel malt with some bitter hops at the end. Body is about average with some great carbonation. With the level of hops that can be found in this beer it is almost leaning toward an IPA. Very good session beer overall but nothing earth shattering in here.

Pours a lovely amber-red color (hence the name) with a light head.  Smells of citrus and spice.  Crisp on the palate with heavy hop flavor and mild sweetness.  A very refreshing and tasty beer and would recommend to anyone who enjoys more hoppy brews.

I picked this up on a recent visit to the DC area, and I was pretty pleased with it.  It is a nicely hopped, definitely-not-boring amber ale.  It reminded me a great deal of McTarnahans, which I also like.

It poured a pretty rich amber color with decent head formation.  Aroma was light, citrus-y, hops.  Flavor was definitely hoppy.  I could find a bit of fault in the beer - it was just a touch stale and cardboard-y up front and just a touch sour at the finish, which might not have been the case if Id had a bit fresher bottle (mine was dated 5/5/07, meaning it was just over 4 months old when I drank it).  Still, there was a lot to like in this beer, including being very drinkable.  Definitely recommended.

Fantastic hop aroma for an amber ale.  Pours amber (duh), with a very small whitish head.  Tastes slightly watery and grainy, but the hops cover up most of the detractions.  If I was not such a fan of the very nice flowery/citrusy hop balance of the beer, I think this beer might suck.  Otherwise, it is just pretty okay.
UPDATED: OCT 29, 2007 Tap at Coles. Amber body, small off-white head, mildly hoppy nose. Nicely balanced hops and light malt. Would make a good quaffer.

Pours a nice clear red hued brown. Minimal head. Nose is like vibrant cherries, but not extremely pungent really. Flavor is nice and woody in a milder way. Hops are present in a leafy and slightly almost smoked way. Medium level sweet edge to it. Very smooth and consistent flavor. Feel has a fairly full level of carbonation sending tiny bubbles over my tongue. Liquid has a good body. Overall very drinkable. Extremely smooth and even, though the sweet kick on the tail end seems slightly out of place
out of the bottle poured like one should.  wonderful hop aroma, big hop flavor with slight malt sweetness.
On tap @ Coles Buffalo NY. Pours a beautiful amber with nice 1 head. hoppy flavor, caramel malts balance & pretty good
Very tasty IPA.  Nice hoppy aromal.  Goes done well. Very nice aroma.  I would recomend this one to anyone.
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2007 Bottle. Light amber. Smells of grapefruit and pine, citrusy. Grapefruit, malt, and hops flavour. Hops finish. Very well balanced. Golden.

12 Oz Bottle. Beautiful floral hop nose, backed with strawberry caramels and tinted brandies. Hop character is so fresh and supple, glowing with resins, fresh cones, and lightly steeped pines. Pours a clear orange-amber, with a wonderfully lacing white head. Flavor a rich, yet classic, blend of hops and malt sugar. Wow, this is delicately balanced, yet nuanced with traditional west coast hop flavor and in nicely dried body. Fresh feeling. Spritzy and melded with citrus. Gentle, yet flavorful. Nice malt backing to the rich, deep hop character. Long lasting grasses and drying herb smack. Excellent.
